text:
Pours a brown tinted ruby red with a small off white head and good lacing. Strong cherry licorice aroma and cherry skin. Taste has fresh bing cherry and some sweetness with a mild tartness. Some cherry skin. Flavor is big and tasty. Medium bodied with medium/high carbonation. Very good fresh cherry with more perceived sweetness than actual sweetness. The tartness helps to balance it nicely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bomber pours bright red with pinkish head big cherry nose with a woody presence taste was very sweet carbonation was moderate

Bottle from Krista in Wisconsin. Talk Garnet reddish-brown with lasting ring and a little lace. Ripe cherry and Woody Aroma with hints of floral and caramel. Very sweet ripe cherry with some toasted caramel and brown sugar sweetness. Woody finished with a touch of tart dryness and lingering Sweet Cherry and brown sugar slightly sticky with fine internal carbonation. Very good but too sweet for my taste. Would probably go well with Rich chocolate cake.

Bottle; pours dark red with a reddish brown head; aroma of homemade cherry pie; taste is sweet and very much like cherry pie; finish is dry, with some lingering cherry; the cherry aroma and flavor is dominant but balanced and not overpowering or artificial; best fruit beer I have had to date
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Totalnie nie mój klimat. Słodki kompot wiśniowy, mdły i jednowymiarowy.

Bottle thanks to the Duke. Pours dark red, with pinkish white head. Aroma is super sweet processed cherry perserves, more cherries. Flavor is sweet syrupy cherry, cherry creamsicle / pie, candied fruit. Craziness!
Bottle. Taste of sweet cherry. Super smooth. Big body. Raspberry candy. Like a long boil of Boon Kriek. Very elegant.

Pours cloudy burgundy with low pink head. Aroma of liquored cherries, almond icing, red berries, bretta. Taste is initial berry sweet followed by cherry tart and then a lingering sweet finish. Light and crisp body with average carbonation.
Dr. Pepper beer, but much better than the soda. Lots of juicy, ripe and tart cherries, some fizz, long lingering finish. Great for the ABV. Great way to top off a great start to the year.
Bottle. Thanks Jon. Beautiful aroma of cherry fruitiness, spice and pastry. Taste is perfect, loads of cherry, pastry, lovely stuff. Rich but easy drinking. Great.

Deep red purple color. Intense fresh cherries in the nose, not in away that any other beer can do it. The balance of sweet, tart and spice in the nose is amazing. Medium full body. So much cherries, so well rounded, like eating and drinking the most flavorful cherries you have ever had in your life. Just perfectly executed.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Thanks Virby44 for the bottle! Poured into the wineglass showing dark vinous wine red with white foam lacing. 

The nose shows strongly sweet maraschino cherries like jolly rancher candies. 

The palate is light bodied and highly carbonated. Strongly forward cherries throughout with a light wheat/malty backbone. Light tartness with a slight acidity balances out the entire beer. Nothing like it. Amazing.

Appearance: Pours a dark, crimson red with 1 finger head & lots of carbonation. Not bad.

Smell: Sour cherry notes with slight sweetness. Nice smelling aroma.

Taste: Sourness hits me straight on. Sour cherry with a dry, wood-like quality.

Mouthfeel: Heavily carbonated but sourness unrelenting. I would have liked some more sweetness to balance it out.

Bottle at RBGT. Pours cloudy ruby. Aroma is superinfused cherries, almost artificial and candy-like. Very sweet, but still medium body, with a refreshing sourness kicking in later. A bit sticky. Sweet palate, with cherries throughout. A bit less would be nicer, though.

I prefer the raspberry tart one this because the flavor is a bit more intense, but dang, these things do not disappoint. Tons of flavor, EXTREMELY long lasting finish. Quite complex too. Yet very drinkable

750 ml poured to wine glass. Split with Jeff and Gretchen. Bottle from 2015 given Patrick K. Pours deep red with 1/2 finger carbonated head. Intense sweet cherry flavor. Slightly acetic, low bitterness. Really work class beer.

Pours a dark ruby red. Aroma is dark cherries. Super fresh and sweet. Taste is incredible. Its like drinking cherry juice. A mix of sweet and sour. Not overly sugary and well balanced. This is incredible.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy light brown reddish color with an off white pinkish head. Aroma is apple cider, cherries, mild tartness. Better tartness in the flavor than a lot of the other New Glarus fruit beers, balancing out the sweetness. Sweet cherry apple tartness in the finish.

Poured from a bottle that has to be at least 5 years old; I kind of forgot about it int he cellar. Oops. 
Aroma is sweet cherry with some, musty, old newspaper notes of oxidation. Aroma reminds me a lot of cherry Ludens, but the age adds some oxidation. Some light malt notes. 
Pours a murky, dull red with some brown hues and a small, fairly thin, slightly tan head that recedes quickly to the edges where a small, thin film lingers for a bit. Faint lacing and no legs. 
Flavor is very sweet with a definite cherry throat lozenge character to it. Some much sweet cherry notes that come across as almost artificial. Some light malt notes with a bot of caramel and some honey. Light toasted bread notes. Some oxidation showing up as old newspapers and wet cardboard. 
Mouthfeel is medium to medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, the age didnt help this beer and only added an oxidation note. Im not sure anything could help this beer though as it tastes and smells like the cherry throat lozenges that toe the line between medicine and candy.

5oz draft sample from brewery tasting room. Deep ruby red, filtered clear with a pinkish head. Intense aromas of ripe cherries, sour cherry candy, dark fruits like plum, against a moderate malt backbone (and no evident hop characteristics). Palate was both sweet and sour, characteristic of the style. Good carbonation. Bit sweet for my taste, but I can see why so many love it. Would make for an excellent dessert pairing, or as a dessert on its own.

Bottle (750 ml). Pours pinkish-red with light pink head and substantial lacing. Fresh cherry aroma. Tart cherry upfront with black cherry skins in the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sweet cherries, saw dust, cherry syrup. Clear, dark, red, small, creamy, reddish head. Medium sweet. More intense cherries, initially sweet, then turning slightly sour and bitter, some citrus fruits, lemon, creamy texture, soft to medium carbonation. Nice Fruit Beer, very nice cherries. Keg at the brewery, New Glarus.
Ruby red red pour with an off white head. Aroma is cherry candy, oak, and some wheat. Taste is Ludens cough drops, damp wood, and a hint of vinegar. Sweet with a little tartness. Light body.
Ruby red beer, from a bomber bought at a Wisconsin convenience store while passing through the state. Sour fruit aroma and an intensely sweet cherry taste. Exquisite tart finish.
Tap at the brewery, 7-19-18. Pours deep ruby, white head. Aroma is cherries, dark cherries. Taste was tart, tangy, very sweet, cherry syrup. Excellent.

Pours a deep rich mahogany-like purple. Almost a plum color. The cherry aroma emanates. It tastes like cherries, but with enough tartness to balance some of the sweetness. It is very sweet though. A very good dessert beer, but not sure Id like this if it opened my night.

Dark, red moscato red. Sugary head with nice lace. Aroma is a nice vivid cherry, as it warms and swirling it, you get a breadyness that is like cherry pie. Has some mineral to it. Taste up front is sweet cherry, foamy body with cherry dominating taste. Finishes with a tapering light tartness to clean up its medium sweetness. Real nice. The Belgian in this is really clean, didnt get much other character and couldnt detect hallertau hops much but maybe they just enhance it. The oak is what maybe enhancing the cherry taste with a vanilla or possibly a coconut character with it. Also a hint of woodiness in aroma and mellow  dry woodiness in taste.

Very cherry. Baked in car for 2 months. 

Almost drinks lime a wine. Maybe in the car too long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the great classics of the American craft beer revolution, gift from Ster who brought it all the way from Wisconsin for me, which I am very grateful for; shared with her and other people at Belgium Chimipalooza. Thick, creamy, off-pinkish head over a hazy, deep cherry-red beer with beautiful ruby glow. Aroma of sweet cherry candy and cherry jam, candied lemon, caramel, lime zest, vanilla, grape peel, ripe blackberry, stewed apple, fruit pie. Sweet, initially almost candyish but still not cloying cherry flavour, very rich like a cherry pie and cherry jam, residual sugars, soft bready wheat base, thin but effective lemony sourish sting peeping up in the middle and lasting till the end, balancing the cherry pie sweetness; spritzy body, sweet and sourish finish, full and not too sticky. Totally different from what I had expected, even reminded me a bit of Lindemans Kriek at a certain moment, but altogether very different from the sweetened cherry lambics at the same time, more bready, more moelleux and - most importantly - much more genuinely fruit-like. Very interesting and unique, too bad this isnt more easily available outside of Wisconsin.
Bottle - Pours like cherry juice. Nose is full-on cherries. Taste is cherries, sweet but balance and really enjoyable. I will pound this beer.

Rating #2200. 750 ml wax-dipped bottle thanks to Homers FBW contest. Aroma is cherries bordering on overripe, flesh and almondy pits. Pours a muddy rust color with a collapsing beige head that falls into a big-bubbly ring; a little lace left behind. Taste is fairly tart, sweet, finishing lightly dry. Tastes like cherry pie filling, with spices (cinnamon) and all, although I dont think those ingredients are actually in the beer. Really tasty, but I liked the Raspberry Tart a lot more, even though this is rated higher on the site. This one is a little too sweet maybe. Still a phenomenal fruit beer, however.

Pours a Dark Ruby red with a nice cherry head. Aroma is of cherry, malt, hay, lemon, blue cheese. Tastes of cherries, cranberries, raspberries, with a slight tart note. I know Im missing notes in here. Great Beer.

Deep red pour with a single finger head. Aroma is full of sour cherries, almost pie like too. Medium bodied. Sour cherries, almost spicy like cinnamon. Sweet and tart all at the same time. The fruit is just so vibrant, it makes me wonder how they make this happen. Reminds me of eating sour cherries. Fruit character is through the roof. A little lace present. World class beer here.

Bottle shared with friends. Pours blood red with a nice white head. Huge cherry/sweet nose that hits you before your glass is front of you. Taste is wildly cherry and sweet-think a wonderful cough syrup you cant get enough of. Supremely drinkable.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Bomber sized bottle. Nice burgundy dark pour. Really nice ripe cherry aroma. Taste is amazing, slightly tart, great finish. Best fruit beers in the world, thanks New Glarus!

Large shared bottle.
Given that this is a fruit beer, it really couldnt taste any better.
The feel too is about perfect.
Aroma: cherry dominated. Appealing but a bit too much cherry candy in the nose.

Appearance: Dark ruby red with small off-white head; Taste: Strong/tart cherry with a wine/tannin finish. Mouth/Feel: Med/Light Body, Clean. Nice brew that when in WI I always have to pick up a bottle or two. Overall: 3.9 out of 5

Bottle in a trade. Pours a plum red with a faint pink head. Aromas of cherries, cherry pie, and oak, almost a faint cinnamon. Flavors of tart cherries, hard cherry candy, cherry tart pastry, oaky tannin finish. Sharp, highly carbonated, acidic mouthfeel. Very sweet and tart. Great beer.

Got in a trade: thanks RRC87! My first winter shipment so I had to have a cold one right out of the box. Split with my wife.

A. Pours a hazy deep red with brown and burnt orange highlights. A small off-white head rises up ever so slightly and leaves night trails of residual lacing down the glass.

S. Tart cherry with vanilla, a touch of oak, and a bit of medicinal character.

T. Tart cherries with some oaky wood character. These give way to a bit more sweetness with some vanilla and a touch of lemon juice. Ends fairly dry with just a touch of residual tartness.

M. On the light side of medium bodied with a medium level of carbonation that helps pick up the residual flavors on swallow.

D. Incredibly drinkable - I wasnt a big fan of the raspberry tart so I got these for my wife not expecting to like them too much. It looks like Ill be trading for some more of these in the near future.

Bottle. Pours ugly and cloudy murky red with light off-white head. Aroma is packed with cherries, candy, dry, dusty and light earthy. Really fruity candy and light hay. Got a lot of marzipan. Taste is fruit bomb, candy, cherries, vanilla, marzipan, sweet and light acidic. Winegum! Light dusty background. Creamy body, light dry finish. Ful body for style and ABV. I dig this.

Bottle courtesy of Klimaet. Hazy deep red with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, cherries, marzipan, almond stones, fruity and a a little tart. Flavour is malt, cherries, marzipan, almond stones, sweet, tart, little sour, little citric and a little bitter.

Bottle thanks to Bill Young. Pours hazy muddy red with a small offwhite head. Aromas of sweet candy cherries, tart candy sours, marzipan, vinegary tartness. Taste about the same. Sour cherries, candy, malty, tart cherry pits.
Bottle courtesy of Klimaet. Nice head with good duration. Color is red. Aroma and taste are tich fruits, flowers, cherries, marzipan, malt and hops.

Bottle thanks to Klimaet! Pours a hazy, deep red. Big pink head. Aroma has tons of cherry, lots of earthy yeast, acid, slight vinegar, slight sulfur. Lemon, red apples. Taste is super fruity, acidic, citric, sweet, juicy, lots of cherry, candy. Nice and drinkable. Average carb and an oily, juicy body. Tasty!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pretty amazing carbonated tart cherry juice with a floral aroma. Tangy sweet very nice balance. Candy cheery Apple. Amazing mouthfeel for abv. Nice pink head that fades. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Red appearance with some lacing when poured in a mug. Cherry scent, but not much else. Very bubbly and bright/tart cherry taste. No bitter aftertaste.

Shared from a bomber bottle at Mike C-Zs 40th birthday party, into a stemmed snifter glass, thanks Timothy! Wow. Wow. Wow. This is one of those rare times when a beer is even more delicious than its extremely high reputation prepared me for. Bright reddish amber colour with sudsy pinkish foam, long-lasting with beautiful Belgian lace. Malty sweet, like beer candy, with red cherry tartness but in a smooth way, nothing aggressive or piercing as is often the case with black cherry beers. No noticeable hops, but enough to prevent a cloying sweetness. Hint of pepper and clove from the ale fermentation. Light body, strong carbonation, spritzy and Champagne-like, lingering sweet tart fruity aftertastes. Simple, as in not overly complex, but man oh man, it is exactly what youd expect from the deScription, but absolutely mesmerizingly deliciously so. Wow.

Where: Neighbor brought back a variety from a trip home to Wisconsin, forever grateful. 
How: 750 ml bottle, shared at a neighborhood tasting.
Appearance: Pours a deep red with white head, some lacing left.
Aroma: Sweet cherries and other fruity notes, tart.
Taste: Tart cherries is the dominate flavor, pretty sweet but balanced.
Palate: Light to medium bodied with high carbonation, very fizzy.
Overall: Spectacular again.

I have to give this a perfect score. Gorgeous deep amber color. Smells of fresh baked cherry pie, flowers, and a hint of vinegar. Very sweet, but with a nice balancing sourness. No evident hop flavor. Tastes of cherries, vinegar, bit of malt. Just an exceptional beer, easily the best fruit beer Ive ever had. Hunt this one down!

Firm dark reddy maroon and a busy looking murk. Proper gummy cherry nose, Frisky and vibrant. Initial taste is rusty woody cheery, builds in sweetness and smooth tartness. Decent carbonation and rich vibrant mouthfeel. Finishes strongly with the earthy cheery, cooling tart linger. Solid although fairly spicy on the last murky pours. Bottle, Garvie Cave, 1st Annual Edinburgh Christmas Tasting

Bottle thanks to Mike. Reddish brown with off white head. Intense cherry aroma, like cherry drops, not much else just cherry. Taste is similar, intense cherry. Im a massive fan of cherry. This is delicious

Bottle at the 1st Annual Christmas at The Garvies tasting 2015. Pours hazy red with a thin white head. Aromas of red fruit, light sour cherry. Taste is cherry, light sour, some bitterness. Sour finish.
Bottle at craigs. Pours deep ruby, nose is cherry, little medicinal, taste is sweet, fruity cherry.

New Glarus Wisconsin Belgian Red is a deep dark reddish brew with a nice head of pink foam. Nose is slightly sweet, but strong natural cherry aroma. Taste is more of the same. Strong, tasty amazing natural cherry at first tart, but finishes sweet6er. Body on the thin side and a bit fizzy. a very awesome cherry flavored brew.

Pours a brown tinted ruby red with a small off white head and good lacing. Strong cherry licorice aroma and cherry skin. Taste has fresh bing cherry and some sweetness with a mild tartness. Some cherry skin. Flavor is big and tasty. Medium bodied with medium/high carbonation. Very good fresh cherry with more perceived sweetness than actual sweetness. The tartness helps to balance it nicely. Fantastic.

Color is a slightly hazy garnet color with some brown. Smell is very cherry, red vines, cherry cough syrup without the medicine, touch vanilla. Taste is a tart cherry at first that makes you pucker at first but then finishes sweet and refreshing. Medium mouth and carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Almost a burgundy colored pour with nearly nonexistent head. Aroma of dark cherries, malt, and staves. Flavor is woody, deep, richly, semi-sweet and tart cherries, almost like a cherry pie. This is straight cherry, just as it should be. Very enjoyable, not many beers can compare to it.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 From notes. Enjoyed at the Great Taste of the Midwest on August 08. The pour is a bright red with a thin white ring of head that dissipates quickly and some good pieces of lace. The aroma is a very strange fermented cherry. There is a decent Belgian yeast up there, and I think thatâs what I donât like here. Not what I was hoping for. The flavor, however, is unbelievable. All cherry, sweet and tart, and it reminds me immediately of a melted cherry Slurpee. This is what itâs all about! The mouth feel is very good and syrupy, with a light carbonation and that lingeringly tart cherry finish that is truly beautiful. This beer is pretty basic, but at the same time, scent aside, does exactly what itâs supposed to. Damn.
Cherries and Belgian nose. Taste of yeasty sourdough and cherries. Wonderful hef like palate. Multi dimensional great Belgian fruit beer.
My favourite of the NG fruit beers. Very sweet, low carbonation, slightly sour cherries and some soft wheat malt - absolutely delicious.

Bottle:
Pours cloudy, dark red-brown with a thick, dark, pinkish-beige head.
Powerful cherry and cream aroma.
Flavour is slightly tart, cherry malt, real, fresh cherry/juice.....spicy....
Massive cherry presence.....so much so that the dryness of the acids made me thirsty....AS I was drinking it.....Im not normally a big fan of cherries, but this one is so spectacular in its presentation and colossal flavor, I cant help but get on board and Love IT !!!
Simply amazing.....

This is easily my favorite of the fruit beers from New Glarus. Pours a beautiful red color. Aroma of fresh door county cherries. Nice slick, but not that sticky, mouthfeel. Sweet semi tart cherry flavor. Cherry dominates the taste for this one. Its sort of like drinking a thick fresh cherry juice. So darn delicious.

1pt 9fl oz bottle poured into tulip glass. Dark red with a pink-tinted off-white head. Pours like a thick rosé. Aroma is thick cherries, slightly sour. Flavor is much the same, sourness revealing itself in the long lasting finish. Palate is quite thick with a fair amount of effervescence. Very nice dessert beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, courtesy Dave, thanks! Pours dark pink/red with a small pink head. Aroma of cherry, cherry pie, light oak. Taste is lightly tart, very sweet, cherry, simple syrup. Palate is slick, lightly cloying, sweet finish. Dessert beer.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2015 Sample at Great Taste of the Midwest. Aroma is cherry, overpowered by Belgian yeast. Appearance is red, off white head. Taste is cherry, oh my god. A yeast or wheat presence. Best cherry beer Ive tasted. Mouthfeel is refreshing, crisp and wonderful. Overall, it misses on aroma alone. Its fucking amazing. The only beer I had twice at GToM.

750ml bottle enjoyed @ home, thanks to Enuratique. Pours hazy ruby with an off-white head. Aroma is cherries and marzipan. Flavour is medium sweet and light tartness. Medium bodied, creamy texture, fizzy carbonation. Finish is fresh, cherries and just delicious.
Ruby garnet color. Clear and white head. Nice carbonation. Wonderful cherry aroma and sour tart flavor with cherries and wine like favors. Great balance as well.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a beautiful ruby red when pinkish head. Aroma is strong cherry nose. Taste is a nice mix of subtle sweetness and medium tartness. Nice long subtle tart finish. Great fresh cherry flavor. Definitely the best cherry beer I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750-ml bottle imported by a friend from the brewery. surprised the label didnt give the abv. label called it a marriage of wine and beer, i thought it was halfway between beer and fruit (cherry) juice. gorgeous clear ruby color, red even through the green bottle. medium body, creamy. at most lightly tart. should have high oxygen radical absorption capacity.

Big thanks, again, to my friend John. A native Wisconsinite who now calls Louisville home, and a true friend. Aroma: Pure cherry juice; low to moderate sweetness; very light tartness (surprising for a beer made with tart Montmorency cherries!); subtle hints of mint and chocolate. Appearance: As advertised, a ruby red pour with slight haze; carbonation is pretty soft and supports a small, bubbly ring of head. Flavor: Matches the nose; still very much a somewhat sweet, juicy cherry experience. You do notice a little more oak at play than in the nose. Towards the finish, there is a very subtle hint of hops that have a slight drying effect, but not enough to quench the sweetness entirely. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, lingering finish. Overall: Really good stuff, but I did enjoy Serendipity quite a bit more. Personally, I wish some of the tart character of the Montmorency came through. Still, I feel fortunate to have tried this, as I have wanted to do so for five or so years.
Easily one of the best fruit beers in the world. Friends consider this a cider. But who cares what its called? Its delicious.

750 ml thanks to Willrunforbeer, much thanks for this! Maybe a year bottle. Aroma is cherry pie filling, and freshly smashed cherries. Nothing artificial about this yet it is borderline fruit juice. Finish has a very mild tartness. Had I sampled this blind without knowing it was beer, I never would have said this was fermented in any shape. New Glarus is pretty much the king of fruit.

750mL bottle from a trade. Pours deep red purple with a pinkish white head. Aroma is fantastic! Like a dark cherry juice. Flavor is a bit of caramel under straight up dark cherries. Almost like drinking a tart cherry pie.

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer. Pours deep ruby red with a thin white head. Aromas of tart cherries. Taste is tart up front smooth and slightly sweet and all cherry. Very nice and refreshing on a hot day.

750ml bottle. Appearance: Deep ruby red, clear, with a pinkish khaki frothy head. 
Aroma: Black cherry dominates, light maltiness
Taste: Tart black cherries, giving way to chocolate and toasted malt sweetness. Bitterness only enough to balance. Has a vinous quality. 
Mouthfeel: Medium bodied with some silliness. Carbonation is high. 
Finish: A mix on lingering chocolate and cherry. 
Overall: Top notch fruit beer with a wonderful balance of cherry and chocolate components. Acidity and high carbonation would make this angriest dessert beer.

Bottle shared at the Cotteridge convention, 24/01/2015. Huge thanks to Leighton. Murky amber / golden coloured pour with a loosw white head. Aroma is sweet cherry cough syrup, marsipan, cherry sweet. Palate is super sticky sweet, moderate carbonation. Flavour is very sweet, cheerry, decent fruit, cherry bakewell. Too sweet for my taste.
Beautiful to look at, dark red with an off white head. The aroma is all cherries. The flavor is sour and dominated by the cherries. Bubbly and refreshing. Best for a hot day.

Bomber share. Aroma is cherry tart. Appearance is a reddish brown with a creamy head. Taste is like cherry soda. It is very sweet and cherry. Palate is sour/sweet. Overall, a really good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark ruby-red with a finger of off-white foam. Moderate lacing. 
Nose is a blast of tart cherries, some caramel notes, and a hint of muskiness. Taste is tart up front with an underlying sweetness thats pleasantly balanced. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Tasty brew.

Hazy copper, thin beige head. Nose is all cherry. Fuller feel than Strawberry rhubarb and serendipity. Cherries in a glass. Best of the three so far.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Medium body and carbonation, full of cherries and lightly sweet malts. Very berry fruity flavor with some mild tartness.
Finally got sme of this. Cherries and raspberries with nice complex malt. Fresh tart cherries powered through. Excellent brew.

Nice ruby color; Medium body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, rich cherries, & berries; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, fruit ( rich cherries), and a hint of oak; Dry finish; Very nicely balanced; Delicious!

Waxed top bottle pours pinkish red. Aroma of cherries. Sweet, moderately tart and of course loads of cherry flavor. Sparkling and light. Spectacular!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle from Jeffs in West Bend during the initial cherry scare, and cellared for 2 years - shared with K&K. Great reddish orangey brown color. Very clean, tart, cherry, lightly other fruit meld. No noticeable aging. Smoother than smooth. 15.3

Bottle: Dark ruby, blushing cherry color with an off-white chunky foam that seems to either have a slight tint of lavender to it, or the red beer below is playing tricks on me. Straight up cherry aroma. Lightly tart, mostly sweet, almost like a cherry pie filling that needs just another half cup of sugar. Small underscore of brown sugar & grain. Flavor is the same way, just a huge orgy of cherries hammer fucking every single nook & cranny in your oral orifice. Lightly tart & acidic up front & in the finish with a long, drawn out sweetness that bridges the gap in between. The somewhat abrupt, zesty finish ensures that the sweetness of the beer doesnt wear you down too quickly. While I prefer Raspberry Tart (only because I enjoy raspberries more than cherries, really), this is a beyond solid staple in New Glaruss huge portfolio of awesome fruit beers.

Pours clear reddish amber with a thick and fine-bubbled buff head. Aroma has a strong overtone of fresh cherries. Sweet and sour cherry dominates the flavor but lets through peeps of malt and wood. Firm texture has lively fizz and leaves a nice cherry finish. Cheers for cherries!

Bottle Share at Cotteridge Convention 24/01/15

Pours a hazy blood red orange with white head. 
Hints of Cherry, orange, lemon and some exotic fruit., Cereal and Wheat. Quite pleasant and refreshing

Bottle. Pours clear ruby red with of creamy off-white head. Aroma is apples, cherries, bready and cereal malts, and huge floral sweetness. Flavor is chewy malt profile with tons of cherry and apple fruit notes and loads of sweetness. Well balanced and very tasty. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle cotteridge pissup. Wow!!! Red thin head aroma is cherry jam taste same cherry drops some steawberry raspberry so sweet with great tartness to balance out. Great sticky body with good carbonation to break it up. Beer of the night for me sensational stuff good easily have drunk the bottle to myself. I wish I could buy it from my local gas station!

Colour is burgundy red and it pours with a pink thick-set head that stays. Aroma is cherries and hay? Taste is cough drops (in a good way) then tart cherry and a sweet semi-dry finish. The flavour lingers around on the palate for a while, teasing your brain.

Bottle share at Cotteridge Wines. Thanks to Leighton. Cloudy red / brown, small ring of white head. Aroma is cherries, berries, plasticine and jam. Body is medium, slightly foamy, medium carbonation. Taste is juicy fruits, soft malt backbone, jammy sweet, dark cherry compote. For me this was the best beer on the day - complex yet very drinkable.

24th Jan 2015: Cotteridge Wine meet, shared bottle. Cherry B was/is a cherry wine in the UK and this had the same aroma. Sweet cherries abound in this brew from the colour right through to the slightly souring finish. Not really my thing but an interesting take on the more traditional Belgian style.
Bottle share. Cotteridge Beano. Hazy, mucky, reddy amber. Huge cherry. Sour cherry. Taste is sweet. Some light sour. Rich, and a bit syrupy.

Bottled, sampled at The Cotteridge Convention, many thanks to Beersiveknown for this one. Hazy reddish amber with slight head. Sweet cherries from the off in this one, cherryade then a hint of sourness. Next to no subtlety around this. Too over the top for my taste.
Deep autumn rust in color with low to medium carbonation. Taste of sweet, slightly tart candied cherries, slight notes of dark fruit. Full bodied and filling.

Pours a cloudy reddish brown from the bottle with fluffy off-white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of big sweet cherries, malt, and sweet fruit. Taste is big on the fresh fruit, cherry amazing, like cherry ice cream, wow. This is one of the best fruit beers I have ever had.
750ml bottle pours a deep reddy brown color with a bit of head. Huge cherry flavor, nice sweetness and a little cherry tartness.

Bottle split at the Cotteridge Convention, thanks to LKS, 24/01/14.
Reddish amber with a moderate off white/crimson covering.
Nose is cherry skins, almond, tarte berry, cherry bakwell, vanilla.
Taste comprises glaced cherries, sweet licks, lightly soured cherry, red berry compote, jammy berry licks.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sweetish close.
Decent fruit beer but just dont get these New Glarus fruit bombs anywhere near the 4 mark like most folks seem to manage!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at Cotteridge wine convention; cloudy mahogany red pout with a frothy light tan head, aroma has jam and cherry, taste is really fruity, cherry, strawberry, some tartness, excellent gas station beer.
750ml bottle. Pours hazy orange red with a small head. Aroma is sweet jammy strawberry. Taste is sweet and jammy with lots of strawberry. Lovely drop.

Pours a clear shinny ruby/ red with a nice pink medium head. Aroma is strong raspberry with some lemony notes. Flavor is very balanced raspberry sweetness/ tartness with a nice and gentle sour aftertaste. Medium to light palate, really drinkable and tasty. Another winning fruit beer from NG.

750ml bottle. Aged 8 months by me. Deep, dark red with off-white head. Aroma is still a bit syrupy but head and shoulders above any non-lambic cherry beer Ive had so far. Taste is really gorgeous. Has a sticky malt base, maybe a slightly sour brown ale, with juicy cherry goodness throughout. Sweet but never overly so. Why cant all fruit beers be this good?
Red clear pour from 22oz bottle at home. Cherry cherry cherry. I don't like fruit beers but this is fantastic. Not too much - like a perfect fruit punch. So good.
fantastic slightly sour cherry taste. creamy medium body and soooo smooth Fantastic sour. Great cherry taste!

750 mL bottle poured into a teku glass. It smells like fresh, warm cherry pie. It pours a clear and rich, dark, deep red with brown hints, topped by a slightly off-white soapy head that reduces to a big but thin soapy bubble ring with a wispy surface and a light, messy lace. The taste is highly sweet with a medium light sour and very light bitter. Theres quite a bit of soda carbonation to the thin, easy drinker. The medium light body is reminiscent of cherry soda (Cherry 7-up in particular) with a lemon lime touch. Its crisp with a cherry pie, and slight spice, finish. Theres a sugary astringent cherry pie linger to the aftertaste.

Pours a clear dark ruby color with small pink head and practically no lacing. Aroma is mostly cherries with a bit of honey. Taste is sweet at first with a tart finish. Body is medium with lively carbonation and a slightly syrupy mouthfeel An excellent dessert beer, unless you dont like cherries.
Clear dark ruby with a thin pink head. Big cherry and earthy wheat nose. Lovely candy and cherry flavor with some sweet earthy cherry and wheat and Belgian Amber grain note. Lovely.
Sampled during RBSG. From notes. This will be updated later. Cant find exact notes.

Pours a very cloudy mixture of orange, red and brown, with maybe even a slight hint of pink. The aroma smells highly of cherries (maybe even a bit of a cherry cough drop scent). Wow, the flavor starts off sweet, but ends with a bitter/tartness that I can taste predominantly in the back off my mouth. Mixed in with the sweet and tart is also a hint of spiciness.
Aroma is berries. Flavor is similar to Capri Sun. Not bad but is definitely a dessert beer.
Pours cherry red with aroma of tart cherries. Tart and sweet cherry flavor with some hint of oak. Just an excellent beer. Easily the best fruit beer Ive ever had.

You can just stick an IV in my arm of this stuff and put me into a cherry coma. Anyone who rates this beer and doesnt like it can go away. Poured at the Cajun Cafe Festival into small snifters. Brilliant deep red wityh a pink head. Aroma is a cherry bomb with jam-like notes. The taste is a cherry bomb as well. It is slightly sweet but it is so good it doesnt matter. Thats pretty much it. Medium body, mildly sweet, slight dryness at the end. Fucking amazing.

Received this as an extra in a trade. Deep hazy red pour with a light pink head. A huge fruit explosion on the nose. Cherry fruit rollups and strawberry preserve. Sweet, bright fruits. Lovely. Taste is similar. Sweet cherry and strawberry pie filling. Light acid to keep the sweetness in check. Light body, soft carbonation. Excellent.
Excellent fruit beer. Ruby colored. Cherry and oak in the nose. Cherry dominates the taste as well, but with light tartness and sweetness. Bubbly mouthfeel. Couldn't have done a better fruit beer.
Bottle from a trade. Red colour, small head. Soft carbonation. Fruity cherry aroma with sweet hints of honey and candy. Light tartness but too sweet. Not very good.

75cl, no mention of ABV, exclusive American brew, with cherries, thx alot to Eric for bringing this over!, complex fruit brew, sweet/sour/fruity and slightly woody/vinous/spicy, yet not too heavy, balanced, hazy, small head, very good brew
Bottle pours murky red with low head. Aroma is rich cherries, sweet pie notes. Taste is big sweet cherries and a slick finish, intense sweet fruit beer

Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy light brown reddish color with an off white pinkish head. Aroma is apple cider, cherries, mild tart. Better tart in the flavor than a lot of the other new glarus fruit beers, balancing out the sweetness. Sweet cherry apple tart in the finish. Very tasty.

Pours deep ruby red with a bit of quick dissipating head. Nose is cherries, cherry jam, maybe a bit of wood. Tastes like cherry pie, cherries start of sweet then get sour, definite tartness on the second half, a bit of bitterness on the finish. Tartness makes it very drinkable. It's what new Glarus does best, fruit beers. Very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at Where the Wild Beers Are, 6/7/14

I quite enjoyed this beer. It has a nice fruity/cherry nose and flavor. It manages to balance the sweet and the sour as well as any fruit beer that I can recall. Excellent beer.
Bottle. Pour is a dark red with thick head. Cherry aroma. Taste is sweet then tart. Mouth feel is creamy with a dry finish. Too much cherry.
Bottle @ home shared with my wife. Slightly hazy amber pour with a thin reddish head. Obviously lots of cherries here, some light vanilla and almonds with some light tartness. Good stuff!

Bottle: Thanks Hackobock: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Bigger vanilla strawberry head. Deep hazy orange red body.
Aromas of dusty strawberry, not much else...
Flavours of strawberries, light cherries, sweet sour, some other red fruit, intense red and strawberry, light vingear burn while not sour, too tart or vinegar.... Very nice, good balance, full (red) fruity taste with light sweet malty and even some sweet but full red fruit (strawberry, cherry, etc) candy flavour.
Didnt expect this, great surprise, great taste!
Aftertaste is a mix of sweets, bitters, red fruit (mainly strawberry) some light tart ish tones and sweet malts.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel,close to full bodied and a creamy texture.
Super intense red fruit taste, delicius stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
750ml bottle - pours a reddish pink . Cherry cough drop aroma . Light bodied . Huge cherry candy flavor . Awesome . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
So good cherry aroma, Very raisin malts and slight roasted malts that adds so much to the multi dimensional. Great OAK. Slight wine and very tart. ANOTHER MUST!!!
This beer is easily one of my favorite beers. Cherry cobbler aroma and taste. I could drink this all day. This and Raspberry Tart make me wish I lived in Wisconsin.
Bottle. Pours hazy brown red with a little off white head. Smells like Luden's cough drops. Taste adds some sweetness.
once again, new glarus knocks another out of the park. is there anything they cant do?

Cherries, cherries, cherries, cherries, cherries, cherries, cherries, cherries, cherries, cherries, cherries, cherries

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Urge as part of their 4th anniversary event.  Pours a dark red with a one finger white head with pretty nice lacing. Aroma is of ripe cherries, sour cherries, wheat bread, biscuity malts, vanilla, amaretto, some sweet malts, and some light vinegar. Taste is about the same as the aroma with a nice mix of sour and sweet cherries which balance each other out nicely, with some belgian wheat notes and biscuity malts, vanilla, oak, and sweet malts in the background. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a fizzy, dry, sweet and sour, medium-long, crisp, refreshing finish. Overall, a excellent fruit beer that has a nice balance between sweet and sour cherries.
Draft. Red with thin pink head. Aroma of cherries and raspberries. Medium body, cherries, a medium tartness, and a lingering cherry finish.
Bottle, RBAG 2014 prelim. Light scarlet red, pink head. Aroma is pure kirsch, spicy nuances. Lush juicy cherry flavour, not too sweet, very intense, dry finish.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Bottle to goblet at the RBAG14 warmup
Rose, cherry, and candy floss. Reddish/pinkish brown with a thin off white head. Taste is overpowering cherry syrup.

Bottle - Sweet maraschino cherries. Cloudy red/brown with a decent white head. Lots of sweet cherry, but has something odd later that cuts the cloying sweetness a little. Sweet and nice but a dessert beer for sure.

Bottle shared by Toney at RBAG. Cloudy red/brown pour with light white head. Aroma is sweet cherries, jam, a bit of tartness. Taste is sweet cherries up front, almost no tartness, finish is a sweet cherry finish. Kind of like drinking a cherry popsicle, me like.
Pinkish red with a offwhite head. Huge wave of cherry aroma, smells too good to be true. Taste is like fresh cherry juice, sweet, tart, slightly sour. Just great.
Dark red pour. Nose is cherries, crayons. Taste is sweet cherries with a touch of tartness. Medium sticky mouthfeel.

Bottle during RBSG 2014 Grand Tasting at Schlafly Tap Room. Golden brown with off-white head. Aromas of cherries and spices. Tastes of dark fruit, spices, tart notes, cherries, cherry candy. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Solid.
Bottle. Pours deep red with a white head. Smells of strong cherry, sweet. Taste is strong cherry, tart, really strong flavors, good.

Pours a brownish color with some dark red mixed in and small off white head. Aroma is cherry. Taste is more cherry with some sweetness of caramel and sugar in there. Pretty smooth finish with some cherry tartness hitting you. Overall solid offering from New Glarus.

Pours a ruby red color with a slightly pink small head that disappears quickly. Aroma is like a cherry shampoo, that smells slightly medicinal, but not quite. The taste is very nice. Starts sweet, pops a tinge of tartness and then finishes sweet. Really amazing stuff.

750 ml bottle, shared by unknown. Thanks, anonymous! Pours a bright cherry red with quickly fading white head that leaves thin sudsy lacing. Aroma is massive and flows from the glass - cherries all day, every day. Muted sourness, complexity abounds. Flavor is same - an ode to the complexity of the fruit known as cherry. One of my favorite beers of all time, always an event to have a glass of this world class beer. From notes 1/23/10 (Geist Dark Lord tasting)

poured into wine glass.

aroma: remember the cherry-dipped ice cream cones at DQ? thats how this smells, except the cherry is more pronounced. oak/wood comes through, too.

appearance: murky reddish brown. lovely carb bubbles. poor head retention, but ivory and creamy when there.

taste: sweet vanilla and cherry; slightly bitter oak, gives way to soft cherry tart on the end.

palate: fizzy, refreshing. long, smooth finish...

Like a tart cherry soda at first but with a nice rich profile underneath. Big cherry nose, maybe a little cough syrup. High carbonation is appropriate. Cherry skin in the finish. Bright red color. Belgian yeast character isnt evident. Pleasant throughout and a nice holiday or dessert beer.

New Glarus nails another fruit masterpiece. The summer evening is a perfect pairing with this one. Dark red, almost brown, wispy white lacing around the edges. Aroma is a rich cherry pie filling. First sip is actually a malty caramel softness, then the intense tart fresh cherry hits you, with a very dry finish. The finish makes this one, could have been dangerously sweet and syrupy, but instead it is clean and makes me want another glass...
Waxed top bottle pours pinkish red. Aroma of cherries. Sweet, moderately tart and of course loads of cherry flavor. Sparkling and light. Spectacular!
Cloudy red with a ring of foam. Sour cherry aroma with a touch of baby powder. Deep cherry flavors are complex without being too tart. Sweet fruity finish. Thanks cards04. This is a beauty.

750ml waxed bottle shared by JohnGonk on my birthday. Pours a murky mohagony red color with a larger foamy off white head. Aroma of sweet and tart cherries, and some caramel malt. Taste is much the same. Sweet and tart cherries, cranberries, caramel malt, and mild funk. So good!!
Pours dark red, good head retention, very nice lacing, is syrupy, but not overly so. Sweet, cherry smell, faint menthol. Taste is cherry candy, cream soda, fresh.

Bottle poured a clear amber hue w/ minimal head to a ring no lacing. Huge boozy cherry aroma. Initial taste is moderate sweet w/ bold tart finish. Taste is a tapestry of flavor supporting a cherry pie filling. Full bodied and warm finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 Bottle shared. Pours clear red brown with a ring off white head. Aroma of sweet cherries. Flavour is over moderate sweet. Light medium bodied with high carbonation. Really dont understand the big ratings in this, its like one of those sweetened Belgian Krieks that we all typically turn out noses up at.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2014 66cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Very thin pink head. Clear red pour. huge cherries in the taste

Dull, hazy, dark amber appearance with minimal, off-white head. Foam quickly dissipates leaving ragged lacing. No malt, hops or yeast aroma to speak of, only a nice cherry smell. Taste is light sweetness, slightly sour, tart, and a little salty. A well built beer, but not exactly balanced as the only flavor is cherry. A great representation of the fruit beer style, with the intended cherry dominance. Light bodied, slick mouthfeel and average carbonation. The finish is long, and maintains the cherry flavor with a little wheat. A standout beer that met my expectations, and I would recommend to a friend.
Bottle..Pour is caramel with a thin head..Nose is juicy cherries, pie, fresh cherry skin..Taste is cherry pie, juicy, fruit juice, amazingness in my mouth..
Bomber. Best of the fruit beers that Ive had from New Glares. Smoot and not overly sweet but refreshing and enjoyable. Great for after dinner.

This is a beer that I have had many times and each time I drink it, I am reminded of how New Glarus sets themselves apart with their fruit beers. This pours a beautiful pink/rose color with a foamy white head that settles into a ring around the glass with a thin layer of delicate lace. The aromas are heavenly. Nice light breads over tart cherries. The yeast profile throughout these New Glarus fruited beers are signature. Whatever is in the hills of Wisconsin, it lends itself well to these brews! It tastes like cherry SweeTarts! A nice, light body along with bright carbonation allows flavor to explode across the palate. Light floral hops, light breads...such a harmony. No cloying sweetness, no puckering tartness....this beer is just right. World class!
bottle. hazy red amber with small head. gigantic cherry flavors both very sweet and tart. significant depth with a hint of almond.
Pours hazy red. Big cherry aroma that lingers throughout the bottle. Champagne like carbonation with pour. Another fantastic fruit beer from New Glarus.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Noams office. Thanks bytemesis. Hazy red with a quickly dissolving bubbly head. Sweet cherry, a little earthy ans marzipan aroma. Very sweet and syrupy taste. Highly drinkable, not carbonated, medium-bodied, marzipan aftertaste.

at a tasting, thanks kerenmk, bubly stable pinkish head, very hazy deep oxidised orange colour, colour, aroma of cherry candy and almonds, flavour of cherry, spice and cakey maltiness, light pleasant sourness but much too sweet, very fruity feel. Very nice but could be better if not so sweet.

Poured into a tulip glass. It is a beautiful sight to behold in the glass. Its really red, but light shines through and it is pretty clear. Aroma of both sweet and tart cranberries with a bit of sourness. The taste is complex and delicious. This beer is a real treat if you can get your hands on it!

Bottle. Pours red with a small pinkish off-white head. Aroma dense and full of sweet and tart cherries. Taste is sweet ripe fruits, tart cherries and almond, finish is tart cherries. Medium smooth body.

Probably the best fruit beer on the market, bar none. Pours a deep red, and when put to the light just glows. Cherries are found on the aroma and on the palate. What makes this unique is that you get both the sweet and tartness of the cherries in this masterpiece.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Noams office. Thanks kerenmk. Pours orange to red with a medium orangey head, aroma of cherry, strong, sweet and fresh, flavor is very sweet with sherry and cherry, almonds, zesty and tasty, medium to full bodied.

Bottle thanks to Bacterial. Pours a lovely clear ruby with pinkish head that flourishes and then disappears quickly. Aroma is full of sweet cherries. Taste is sweet, but a nice and subtle tartness and very light bitterness cuts that and keeps it from being cloying. Medium body, lively carbonation. Overall: everything I expect from NG fruit beers. Sweet, sincere, single-minded, sublime. Also, 4%!

Hot day perfect beer. Ruby red pour pink head. Berry and cherry aroma little bread. Huge ripe cherry and berry mix, not that medicinal cherry taste, the good kind. Thin body and lively carbonation. So good.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 On tap at brewery tasting room. Deep crimson and cordial-like. Aroma is generic fruit. Taste is sweet, fruity, mild tart. Couldnt drink a lot if this but delicious. Finish is sherbet fizz. Overall, definitely more fruit than sour. Very mild tang. Solid and drinkable.

Bottle shared by a non-Ratebeer friend, thanks JM! ;) Pours a clear red with a low white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is of cough syrup (ugh), cherries blended with something you found at the back of an apothecary cabinet. Taste is of cherry kool-aid, too sweet and artifical for me. Mouthfeel is juicy, litterally like drinking some sweetened fruit juice from the store. Blah. Carbonation was prickly. Not sure where I stand on this one, this was way too sweet and artificial. Maybe we got a bad bottle? Bad batch with a less than usual attenuation/fermentation problems? Either way Im off the scale (no way Id give 4+ to this) so its definitely pointing in that direction.

From the April 2014 3R6P gathering. +++ Sampled from a 750 ml green bottle this beer poured a murky red color with a small foamy beige head that left a bit of lacing. The aroma was sweet and tangy sugar and mixed berry jam. The flavor was sweet, tart and tangy with jam, and a strong cherry pie filling presence. Long cherry pie filling finish. Moderately full bodied. Lovely.

wonderfully crafted beer, taste/aroma is cherries cherries and more cherries. it is a little rich and can get thick to drink towards the end but that would be my only compliant, otherwise truly unique and wonderful beer

The color is a dark red color with a small pinkish head, and the aroma blends a heavy cherry with a bit of chocolate malts. The taste has a heavy sweetness with a slight sourness, leaving a nice tartness. The palate fuses a medium body, average carbonation, slick texture, and a long sweet finish.
Bottle at BOSS thanks to Ryan. Holy cow. Wonderful stuff. Pours ruby red. Aroma is cherries and sweetness. Slightly tart. Really really nice. Sweet but finishes only slightly sweet. Really nice.
Three Taverns Bottle Share. Pours Light red with big lively white head. Scent is cherry sweet tart. Taste is much the same. So much fun. Bubbly and live in the mouth. Bottle - Received in Trade

Bottle from NG, year round beer now pretty easy to get...a case. Poured clear ruby red with beige pink head that dissipates. Aroma right after opening as cough syrup cherry but from a tulip glass is toned down sweet tart cherry kind if earthy. Light carb visible in the glass with med bod. Very slight tart cherry sour taste. Well rounded and fun to drink. Would love in summer.

Vintage 2009 or 2010. Dark pink-red hue with mostly diminishing white head. Virtually no lacing. Nothing but cherry on the nose. Strong cherry throughout the experience, but it gets more tart as it starts to warm. I dont care how many times I have this it never gets boring. Love this beer, wish this was not my last bottle.

Bottle thanks to cbfobes. Pours a clear pinkish red with a very light pink head. Huge aroma of cherry. Maybe to a fault. Almost lasted like cherry halls or jolly ranchers. Sweet taste but it gets a bit cloying after some time. Still a delicious beer.
Bomber thanks to my sister. Garnet with a beige head. Vanilla and cherry aromas. Really smooth with rich cherry.
Wonderful copper/cherry color. Nice sour ale base with a hint of cherry to balance it all out. Great beer

Bottle, thanks Chase! Aroma is awesome cherry pie and some hints of tartness... stops short of coming across artificial/cough syrupy. Flavors are of cherry pie, especially as it warms. Light body with nice carbonation. Not too sweet, but also not tart... walks the middle really well.

Bottled. Poured a foggy ruby with a fairly good lace from a pinkish off white head. Smelled of fruit - beyond the cherries it is hard to make out any other scent. Tastes very sweet. Obviously made from cherries with a hint of tart apple during the after taste. I can understand why this is a great award winning beer - however the sweetness is not for me. But I have yet to find a New Glarus that I havent enjoyed and its always a pleasure to drink their brews.

From a 75 cl bottle shared at home. Pours a clear ruby red with a thick pinkish tan head. Aroma of cherries and almonds. Flavors of cherry pop, sweet but surprisingly not cloying. Quite interesting, quite special.

So this is spectacular. Pours a deep blood red with pink head. Aromas are cherry to the power of 10. Maraschino cherries, cherry juice, cherry cough syrup, canned cherries. Tastes like all of those things with some oaky notes. Sour and sweet with a great fizzy and smooth mouth feel. Astounding beverage.

Sample at First Sunday. Pours a dark, hazy, and reddish caramel color, with a small, beige head. The aroma is strong and distinct cherries, so intense its reminiscent of cough drops or a lollipop. Behind that is a lovely layering of raspberries, chocolate, and brown sugar. Very sweet flavor, with a good, mellow sourness. Medium body, with an acidic and crisp mouthfeel. High carbonation gives it a bubbly, velvety feel. This beer is very forward and focused. The cherries are dominant, and the rest of the beer reinforces it. The result is delicious, very drinkable, and enjoyable from initial aroma to the last sip.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 75cl bottle into flute. Minneapolis. 

Appearance: royal cherry red. Bubbles floating up from bottom. Very little head. Some lacing. 

Aroma: heavy cherries, a little musty, a little yeasty. 

Taste: sweetness up front. A little tart. 

Palate: full, rich body. Lots of texture. Carbonation gives a slight bite. Rich cherry finish. 

Overall: a very very rich beer. The flavor is really nice. The cherries are delicious. Very sweet.a really great beer, and might be even better with michigan cherries!

Strong cherry flavors. Reminds me of cherry pie and cherry slushies. Tart and sweet. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to UMNBeerhunter for this as an extra!

A: Pours deep, deep cherry red. Says over a pound of cherries in every bottle - it shows. Thick quilt of pink-tan fine foam comes and goes with tips of the drink. Excellent clarity. 

S: Tart cherries with slight yeasty scent. Very mildly syrup smell.

T: Yep, cherries. Like a liquid jolly rancher. Very, very nice. 

M: Thick, syrupy, light to moderate carb. This beer sticks to my mouth. Man this would be perfect with a dollop of Cherry Garcia in it.

D: Absolutely a digestif for a warm afternoon. Slowly sip while reading a book. Very nice.

Serving type: bottle

02-26-2011

Clear Ruby red with a fizzy head and high carbonation. It smells like sweet cherry fruit juice with moscato. It also tastes like cherries with some mild malt and barley notes. Very sweet tasting. Body is light and a bit syrupy but it doesnt hurt the quality. Quite tasty!

750ml bottle thanks to bytemesis! Pours nice hazy ruby red with a finger of off-white head. Nose is rich juicy cherries, berry, earthy fruit skin. Taste is cherry bliss! Lots of rich juicy cherry, cranberry, sweet fruit. So incredibly easy to drink. This one is not at all artifical tasting like so many cherry beers. Probably the best non-kriek cherry beer Ive tried yet. Finish is sweet ripe cherry pie, very tiny hints of tart as it warms. Great!

750ml bottle In a tulip. Pours hazy, deep ruby with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma of cherries, sweet malts, and light oak. Flavor the same with a lot of cherries. Average texture. A really good fruit beer.
From a roughly year old bottle. Delicious to be sure, not quite as good as the Raspberry Tart, but awesome. More beery. Definite cherry flavor.

Bomber. Thanks Mike! Pours a cloudy burnt red with a decent light pink head. Aroma of tart and sweet cherries. Taste is more sweet cherries than tart cherries. Wish it was easier to find. Drought of 2012 was a problem the way I heard it.

Hell yes. As someone who grew up a big fan of Ludens cherry "cough drops", i love this beer. Clear reddish brown color, fizzy. Cherry syrup aroma, very reminiscent of the aforementioned Ludens. Flavor is more sumptuous, cherry chocolate cake. A little tartness. Wears out a little after a glass but, until then, its fantastic. Ive never had a beer like it.

A: Reddish/Orange Hue, Passes Minimal Light, Minimal Head Ring, Minimal Head

S: Cherry Syrup

T: Sour Cherries

M: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Sour

Overall, an interesting cherry ale with a sour yet sweet. Definitely worth the experience.

From a bottle cellered for 2 years. Wine glass, small frothy off white head that recedes to the sides of the glass. A red mahogany body that is semi-opaque and dark. The aroma is pure unadulterated cherry, clean quality without the typical fake cherry flavoring. Still a ton of carbonation, sweet cherry tastes hits the tongue, the tingling leads into a long biting finish, acidic and tart. This is was most people try to create when doing a cherry beer, or any fruit beer.

Bottle thanks to Sparky! Pours hazy reddish/brown with a thin white head that quickly disappears. Aroma of this is cherries, cherries, and cherries. Taste is cherry pie, nice balanced medium bodied dry finishing beer.

Bottle share at Borefts - thanks! Cloudy reddish brown with a good white head. Aroma is cherry, marzipan, dates. Syrupy mouthfeel, full bodied, sweet and fruity on the palate. Taste is cherries, cherry cordial, dates, sugar syrup. Sweet and delicious!

Year old bottle thanks to stevencon! Slightly cloudy deep crimson pour with a tiny head. Massive cherry aroma with a tart of tartness. Slightly sweet flavor on the front of the tongue quickly turning into huge cherries and slight tartness. Sweet tart mouthfeel with a quick dry end. Pretty damn tasty.

Super deep ruby red pour small head dissipates quickly. The beer looks like red lipstick. Huge cherry aroma fresh sugary aroma that is very natural. Tastes just like cherries with a dry wheat finish. I wish I could drink this all the time.

800th rating! Older bottle. Reddish-tan body with a small tan head. Huge cherry aroma with some pie spice, and a bit of funk. Sour but balanced flavor with lots of cherries and lingering spice. Some wood detectable but hard to pick out with so much going on. Awesome.

Bottle shared by my brother-in-law. Pour is a dark red, no noticeable head. Wow, tons of dark cherry on the nose, slightly tart/sour. Sweet, sour, cherry, awesome. Finishes perfect, really good sipper, wish I had more.
Thanks for the share Jordan. This brew was just up front delicious and refreshing. Lots of tart cherries and a sugary fruity finish make for a fun, delectable dessert drink.

Thanks Keir for extra-ing me this mofo. Aroma is big tart cherries, light oak and funk. Very nice. Pour is beautiful with a hazy rose-red colored pour. Tastes like a cherry lambic. Tart cherry and balanced sweetness make this crushable as hell. Good stuff.
Like the raspberry, this cherry beer is a perfect representation of a sour cherry beer. Find it and savor every drop.
Immediate cherry aroma. Beautiful cream colored head. dark ruby red almost orange body. Very one dimensional. But thats to be expected.Super cherry flavors! Cherry Champaign without the Champaign.

Bottle from brewMane. Thanks! Shared with beastmaster. Pours deep opaque ruby red with cream and Reddish one finger head Huge cherry aroma omfg style. Flavor is straight up jolly rancher cherry. Then more cherry. Bit of sour and mostly sweet. Light mouthfeel with medium heavy carbonation. So obvious these are actual fruit and not some flavored syrup. Over the top cherry and very good fruit beer. Still not as amazing as Raspberry Tart.
22oz bottle pours dark red with small red/tan head. Sweet cherry aroma. Sweet cherries just like a cherry pie. Great beer.

Bottle. The pour is straight red. The aroma is all sweetness. The taste is is sweet cherry, but very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Unbeatable. Super consistent over the years.  I cant wait until its back. Im in love.

thnx to nbutler !
pours red, white small foam, intense, cherry, candy in the smell
taste is sweet, candy to the extreme, like serendipity ! i LOVE it !

Thx! to Kraddel. 75 cl. bottle sampled. Dark red, very dark strawberry look, fading dark pink head. Huge cherry candy in the nose, very sweet & candy-like, incredible & nothing else. Taste is hugely sweet cherry candy, good kind of sweeteners, pure candy, little else flavor-wise, incredibly sweet spices,.. Light very easy to drink. Pure candy, reminds me a bit of Lindemans Kriek. Love it.
Bottle trade.  Very syrupy.  Good flavor, share this with a friend or 3.  Really only need about 4 ounces at a time.
Dense and tart, with a bit of a plum juice texture to it. Strong cherry aroma, full body and very sweet, a truly unique beer!

Snifter pour of deep hazed burnt red. Nose is great cherry and and tartness, strawberry candies... Those little red hard ones with the soft centers. Flavor is like tart cherry candy. Sweet, a little, but not overbearing. Really an enjoyable beer, and even better at 4%. I could drink this by the bottle...

Apples and cherries galore. A bit sweet, slightly medicinal amidst the distinctly New Glarus yeast strain.

Pretty good, but I've had bottles that are much better. Bottle variation-- :(

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Very tasty. Tart and sweet simultaneously. Maybe even a little vinous. Only complaint is that it's a little tough to get through a big portion as the sweet/tart thing wears on your palate. Fantastic in reasonable doses. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2013 Bottle.  Pours a mostly clear red orande with a frothy off white head that had reddish tints and decent lacing.  Aroma is overriped cherries, and then more cherries,  mazipan, earthiness.  Flavor is moderately sweet cherries, with a medium acidic finish.  That has a long duration.  Really a lovely brew and me thinks this beats Serenpidity in the NG fruit beer line up.
Surprised I didnt like this better, considering I love cherries and have no aversion to fruit beers. Too sweet and not enough tart, perhaps.

Bottle pour cloudy red.  Nose of sweet cherry candy, almost like lifesaver.  Taste of sweet and tart cherries, no bitterness.  More like cherry soda.  Always a fun beer year to year. I like the bottles very fresh, to preserve all the cherry aroma and flavor.

Bouteille de 750ml, capsule métallique recouverte de cire rouge. Une gros merci Patrick et Marheb. Liquide rouge-orange-brique avec une belle mousse beige pâle durable. Le nez est en constante évolution, cest ce qui fait la force de cette bière. Il y a des cerises, un fond de tarde au cerises, de la plasticine rouge, de la chandelle rouge faîte de cire dabeille. La bouche est superbe, mordante, cerise mais pas une caricature comme du sirop pour la toux. La finale est sèche, désaltérante, on en redemande mais il nest reste plus. Sublime. Un monstre malgré ses 4% dalcool.

Bottle courtesy of changeup45. Sweet-tart cherry and light malt aroma. Cloudy amber tinged garnet with a small creamy pink head.  Sweet-tart cherry, creamy malt, smooth oaky vanilla flavor.  Smooth creamy, medium full body, moderate carbonation. Simply yummy and amazing.

Une véritable leçon à ceux qui croient que la grosseur de la bière influence directement la charge des saveurs. La cerise au naturel, de la chair au noyau, du nez au fond du palais. Malgré la discussion que jai eu avec Shaun Hill sur cette bière, je maintiens ma position.

Une bombe offerte par le Brewligan lui-même.  Merci Martin!  Prochaine étape, la Raspberry?  Bon, revenons à cette bière qui porte une robe unique, quelque chose comme la naissance dune nouvelle couleur.  Une tête mousseuse pleine de fierté et une dentelle comme des cheveux en bataille.  Un nez unique, singulier, profond et, dans les premiers instants, déconcertant.  Des cerises et des fruits poussiéreux.  Un fond épicé et des amandes douces.  Véritablement, quelque chose comme une mystification du sens olfactif.  Sur les papilles, un invraisemblable mélange de notes fruitées justement sucrées avec des notes surettes habiles et bienvenues.  Des houblons surranés à la manière dun lambic.  En bouche, une solide impression laissée par cette potion magique qui ne tire que 4% dalcool.  Ni plus ni moins un tour de force qui donne un corps tout en courbes et des bulles qui bougent parfaitement.  Une langue qui sassèche devant cette impresionnante construction.  Une finale ravissante, aux multiples morsures fruitées, qui confirme son ultime beauté.

Hazy orangey ruby. Small off-white head with retention and lace. Aroma full of cherries but its soft rather than sharp and biting. Medium bodied and bursting with flavor. Cherries of course - moderate sweetnes. Has a little zing but the slight tartness and sourness is very clean and rounded - smooth. Soft carbonation. Well-balanced, delicious and refreshing. Have had this a few times and will have it many more.

reddish, orangey color, depending on how the light hit it.  nice head. good carbonation.  strong cherry aroma, smells so good you can almost taste it.  Beautiful cherry flavor, like a liquid cherry pie.  perfect

Poured into 12 oz snifter. Smells of sweet, tart, cherry. Pours deep, thick ruby with minimal creamy head with slight red tint. Taste of sweet carbinated cherries...almost like a thicker champaign. Lingering cherry finish. This is probably the best "fruit beer" Ive ever had.
I am not a cherry fan, but this beer is fantasic.  Poured a deep red color with a thick head that dicapted slowly.  Aroma of Cherries and other fruit undertones.  Very tasty little snack.

Bottle. Pours a clear deep red. Aroma of incredibly sugary cherries. The taste is reminiscent of homemade cherry pie filling. Great beer despite almost being too sweet (wish it had just a touch of tartness).

750mL bottle.  Unsure why I hadnt rated this already.  Poured deep ruby with mild lacing.  Flavor of sour cherries.  Actually tastes like a boozy cough medicine of sorts.  Medium bodied.  Cough medicine with alcohol, excellent stuff.

Yeah boii. This is some funny stuff. Pour deep ruby red, with a solid onefinger white head. 
Aroma is sooooo packed with cherries. Plenty of cherries. Some sour cherry sweets ans slight tart in here as well, but everything has something do with cherries. Hot dang diggedy!!
The taste is fruity sweet upfront, with some slightly sour notes to it as well, suiting this beer perfectly. 
Medium bodied, with a semi-flat carbonation. A huge thanks to Ryan for sending me this monster of a cherry bomb/adult candy - beer.

This is great! The nose is so intense with american cherry its bonkers. Just a tiny hint of tartness on the nose. It is so fruity... Its like candied cherries in fact. The taste is fresh and creamy at the same time. Fruity and just a little tart.. I would usually prefer a more sour expression but this works. It a Wisconsin friut bomb and it is a real treat. Very pleased I got to try this. It maynot be the most ballanced beer to date but who cares. It has real personality.
Really enjoyable.  Dark red.  Lots of cherries.  This is more of a mild sour with a lot of cherries.  Medium carbonation, low for a sour.
Jumped over the border to grab a bottle of this and pour into a flute. Pretty good stuff if youre in the mood for fruity beer/sparkling wine hybrids.
Good head red color hint of cherries I think this is a good beer kind of sweet with a slight tart flavor.
Pours a dark red with medium lacing. Heavy sweet cherry with a hint of tartness. Medium bodied Medium finish. Very sweet but good for what it is.

Pour is deep ruby red in color with a slight brown tinge. Huge bubbly white head that fades quickly. Aroma is of cherry juice, crushed cherries, and sour cherries. Flavor is pretty much pure cherries at well but with a nice subtle sourness. Amazing beer if you like cherries, excellent mouth-feel .

Bottle from trade with Crajun.  Pours a beautiful dark ruby red color with small, fizzy head that fades and collects at the edges.  Great lacing on the glass.  Aroma is a big cherry bomb, like smelling a fresh jar of maraschino cherries or maybe cherry pie filling.  Makes my mouth water.  Taste is amazing.  Perfect balance of cherry sweetness, tart cherry, and acidity.  Its crazy how much cherry flavor is packed in without an overpowering or cloying sweetness.  This is my first New Glarus beer Ive tried and it wont be my last.  Thanks Kevin!

Pours a rich muddled ruby color with a finger or two of off white foam. Aromas are sweet cherry pie, touch of malt. On the palate this beer is sweet. Great cherry flavor with hints of toasted malts in the finish but its hard to get over the sweetness. Its not bad in fact I enjoyed the first 6-8ozs tremendously as the cherry varietal is delicious but after that I just wanted to pour it over some ice cream like a framboise
Amazing.  Thank you juiceisloose.  Ruby pour.  Aroma is cherries and oak.  Taste follows suit.  Body is a little fizzy, but not too thin.  Havent had a better fruit beer to date.

A near perfect beer. Wonderful cherry and apricot aroma, topped off with a creamy off-white head. Absolutely delightful acidic taste all over the tongue, especially on the sides. Pleasant aftertaste. I say near perfect because of its high carbonation. Expect lots of burps when drinking this awesome brew.
Best fruit beer available!  A must buy when in Wisconsin.  Really wish New Glarus would sell outside of the state. Door County cherries and beer, a perfect match.

From a shared wine bottle/bomber. Pours red, looks like effervescent red wine. Noticeable but not overbearing cherry flavor. Slightly sweet but mostly tart - you cant tell where the tartness from the cherries ends and the acidity from the yeast and brewing begins. Really enjoyable.

I got a 750mL bottle from Woodmans in early Fall 2012 for $8.79 when I heard about the shortage of Belgian Red until early 2013. 

It pours a dark maroon color with a slightly pink, bubbly head. The scent is rich with fermented cherries giving it a very sweet aroma. The taste is rich, sweet, and fruity with an overall great cherry flavor. Its smooth, refreshing, delicious, and slightly tart. One of New Glarus signature brews that is regarded as one of the best fruit beers one the market. Definitely something you have to try.

Draft at several bars in Madison, WI. Not a fruit beer fan, but really loved this stuff. Lots of cherry flavor, a little tartness to balance the sweet,, malty character in the background. Way in the background. Very nice, balanced taste and certainly drinkable.

Bottle. Pours hazy red amber with a medium beige head that dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is dominated by cherry, almost like canned cherry pie filling. Flavor is strong cherry, quite sweet, with sweet tart sourness. Pretty impressive beer, actually.
Dominating cherry.  Red.  Tastes like a cherry soda.  Fizzy.  I cant tastes wheat, hops, nor barley.

Bottle. This is almost not beer. Id say more of a sparkling wine with cherry pie. Still, it tastes damn good, so I cant complain all that much. The pour is bubbling and frothy, with a bright white head and pretty Kool-Aid esque, red translucent body. Aroma is of cherry-apple juice and apple pie, with a minor acidic yeasty quality. The drinkability is outstanding and, as stated, hard to describe as beer, but still an enjoyable bubbling, juicy, and lightly tart feel. The fruity cherry pie, spiced apple cider, and pear fruit are big and juicy up front. Notes become more mellow with an added breadiness through the finish. This was a treat.

Pours a dark red with a reddish tan head. Aroma is absolutey mouth watering cherries, malt, and hints of milk chocolate. Taste is fresh cherries, sweet tart candy, milk chocolate and malt. Perfectly balanced palate. Thick, creamy, low carbonation, and a sweet candy like finish. I never thought Id find a better beer than New Glarus Cherry Stout. I was wrong! This is the absolute top of the line! There is no better as far as I am concerned!

Bottle, as pictured.  I bought this somewhere in Wisconsin.  Poured a clear bright red.  Smelled and tasted extremely sweet, very cherry-ey.  Awesome beer, just enough tartness in the taste to balance it.  Doesnt taste remotely like any beer Ive ever had, save for their Raspberry one.

Poured into my Founders snifter. 

A: Pours a great ruby with pinkish hues around the edges when held up to the light. A nice light pink head forms with a vigorous pour, about 1.5 finger but recedes quickly. No real lace to speak of but a nice ring follows the brew down the glass. 

S: Candied cherries up front with a slight tartness. Has a slight medicinal smell but in a good way. Has some hops to it that peak in around the cherrys and nice barley to smooth it out. 

T: Hello cherries, so nice to finally meet you! The cherries are extremely sweet and candied in nature, almost like a cherry lollipop. The taste transforms into slight bitterness at the end, but its very mild. 

M: Medium bodied with a great carbonation. Coats the palate with a thinly veiled sweet cherry. A little sticky. 

O: I normally do not like fruit beers or sweet tasting beers, but this guy really struck a chord with me. I wouldnt be able to drink it on a regular basis, but it was nice to have after a good dinner. Im interested to see how the raspberry tart Ive got in the fridge compares.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-20-2011

Im not sure what more I can say about Belgian Red that hasnt already been said.  Fir what it is, its perfection.  Gorgeous ruby red color with some slight fizzy head.  The aroma is intoxicating sour cherry and some hops.  I love the way this ale tastes.  The sour and sweet cherries are incredible.  This one is a real treat.

750ml right after the Rasp Tart. Pours almost the same copper/red color with a nice looking head. Huge ripe cherry aroma wafts from the glass. Sugar, tart funk, and some wheat notes come to mind. Flavor is easy drinking with ripe cherry, caramel, and some funk. Nice and easy drinking. Reminds me of Cerise but 50times better

Serving: 750 ml. bottle.  It pours a reddish brown color with a slight head.  The nose reminds me of sweet cherries and a freshly opened pack of toilet paper.  I am guess there is a little oxidation here.  The flavor is on the sweet side and lacks a balancing tartness.  There is plenty of cherry flavor to go around through and more oxidized paper too.  Light on the tongue and easy to drink, but it just reminds me of a wine cooler.  Im not getting what all of the buzz is about.

Bottle from Jaschais in 2011. Aroma and taste of straight up cherries. Had a distinct and potent flavor with some nice carbonation. Goes down like apple cider, real fast. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Its a rich, sweet dessert beer loaded with cherry flavor that tastes like actual cherries rather than the fake pie filling taste of something like SA Cherry Wheat.  Its really, really good.  Lightly tart.

Blends well with Blabaer, Hunahpu, and any other thing Geiger pours it into.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2013 I?m not going into too much detail here because I could write a book about how wonderful this beverage is. There is a great minor tart & sweet cherry taste. The finish is refreshing. This is a very relaxing beverage. It is a must try.

Bottle shared at weihenheizens tasting. Pours kind of a murky brown with a little  bit of red highlights. Some white foam for a head. The aroma is very much like a cherry jolly rancher. Taste is sweet cherry jam with just a hint of some acidity. Just a slight tingly feel on the tongue for the mouthfeel. Thanks for sharing!

Poured into a champagne glass. Thick cream colored foam on top of a light burgundy red beer. Slowly dissipates to a ring with nice lacing. Smell is sweet cherry reminiscent of candy. Taste is more of a sweet darker cherry. Not very complex.  Light palate with medium carbonation. Overall a very nice cherry ale. Not overly sweet and easy to drink. Ive not found anyone that doesnt like it.

Bomber. Thanks to Jae-In. Big soda pop, cherry, and cinnamon nose. Wine-spritzer color, no real head at all, good lacing. Fruit attack initial, very tart mid, and simmers down in final. Sharp, very crisp, and astringent. This is a special experience, indeed. Not quite beer; not quite not

The aroma of this beer is amazing. You may think aroma is not that important, but this beer is excellent proof that aroma matters. The beer also has a great flavor. I have tried it as a complement to red sauces and it makes a great foil for these types of dishes.

Aroma is cherries, mild sweetness and funky yeast.  The flavor is juicy cherries, fruit undertones, some sweetness and a long and very tart finish.  Preferred the Raspberry over the Cherry, more of a case that I dont care for cherries, but still very appreciate this ale for what it is.

A-- Poured a lighter shade of black cherry. thought it was a brown ale at first. Very clear and very little head, what head was there was white at at best film only. 

S-- Cherry soda. Plain and simple. Great nose. Cherries and brown sugar. Ripe and fresh. Very tart nose with this. Has my mouth watering already. 

T-- Black cherry, cherry jam, candied cherry. More cherry than you can throw a stick at. Highly carbonated and closer to soda than beer. 

M-- Literally like drinking cherry pie. Get brown sugar, bread, cherries (duh) and a lot of tartness in the finish. Oak is there but reserved and soft. helps contrast the cherries and adds dimension to this. A whole lot of acid with this. high carbonation and light feel. Very nice. 

O-- Reminds me of the Thorogoods Apple beers but with the ABV toned down, drinkability higher, and obviously being cherry. Closer to sparkling apple cider in the fruitiness of this and the drinkability of it. Stunning beer for summer.
Sample from a bottle at Natifest. Little off-white head. Good lace. Awesome, unique cherry belgian nose, very nice fruity sweet aroma. Light crisp carbonation, dry texture. Good tart taste. Awesome

Bottle to taster at Natifest (thanks Nate). Looks good; opaque and reddish with bubbly white lacing. Smells good too; sweet and fruity. Tastes solid; sweet and tart like cherries, with an average mouthfeel. Pretty good.

Medium cherry amber color, 1" head that slowly drops away, strips of lace.
