Like the best krieks, starts with straw and malt, followed by real tart/sweet cherry taste to burst in quickly and smoothly.  This continues blissfully through the finish.  Surprising taste for 4%, and somehow delivers the fruit without cloying.  Highly recommended.

750mL red wax-dipped bottle c/o Summer Secret Santa 2012.  Huge, huge thanks for this one!  Pours hazy, cloudy dark ruby red and crimson, with gradations of orange layered throughout.  The 2-finger head is ever-so-slightly pink-tinged.  The aroma is overwhelming fresh cherries, noticeable as soon as the cap pops off; mashed, pureed, tart, sweet, sugar-dusted cherries, with lightly tart cherry skins as well.  The flavor is sweet and sugary fresh cherry and cherry pie filling.  This trends toward tart cherry juice and cherry-infused vinegar, with a slight bitter finish laded with cherry stones and skins; prickly, and tart.  Medium-bodied, high carbonation, tart, and really smooth.  This is a really nice beer, and the best of the style Ive ever had.  Sweet and fruity, but never cloying; my wife loved this.  Thanks santa!  [1099]

Red pour, virtually no head.  little carbonation.  Tart cherry in the aroma.  Thake the best cherry pie youve ever had and put it in a glass.  Tart cherry, yeast, slight funk.  Fantastic.  Easily the best fruit beer Ive had.
Pours with little carbonation, great sour cherry nose and flavour. Good tart finish that lasts

Pours a dark cherrywood color with an off white, bubbly head. Taste is dead on, exceptional, pulpy cherry flavor without the aftertaste of a cough syrupy mess. Full and hearty sweetness, slight sourness, makes this first-rate. My girlfriends who dont like beer would like this beer. Id pair it with a bread pudding amongst a drizzling of dried cranberries.
Pours a nice ruby red with an off white head.  Aroma and taste is sweet and cherry, kind of like cherry pie.  Medium carbonation and just flat out wonderful. Need more of this great stuff.

Pours a ruby red with a slightly orange head. Sweet cherry aroma. Taste is sweet, almost medicinal cherry, combined against undertones malt. Dry, very slightly tart finish.  Not really my style, but a great fruit beer

UPDATED: APR 12, 2014 Bottle 750ml.
Pours brownnish with some red, featuring a nice beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is of massive cherries, and raisin bread. Taste is of cherries, very sweet, some acidity, sourness. Malt. Fermented fruits. Overall: Very refreshing, huge cherry taste/aroma. Some feeling of sparkling. Maybe a little bit too sweet. [Note: Just had another taste of this, probably from a different batch. Was way sweeter than first time I had it. This is not at all as good as the first time I had it. Wont change score here but: [03/2014= 7/4/7/3/14]

Bottle shared by Chaney. Thanks Brandon!

Served in a champagne flute, this renowned beer appears remarkably similar to cherry juice. The color is a beautiful, vibrant ruby hue. There is about an inch of head that fades over a few moments.

The smell, which is easily detectable from a few feet away, is reminiscent of cherry pie, with the cherries being predominantly of the sweet variety.

The taste is exactly what the aroma would indicate. Cherry pie, cherry juice, cherry cobbler, cherry soda - you name it. This beer is all about the cherries.

At a mere 4% abv, the alcohol is an afterthought. The feel is pretty good, though the beer is intensely sweet.

Like a great dessert, this is best enjoyed in small quantities. After about 4 ounces, I have had my fill and the beer begins to become cloying.

Pours medium brown with medium beige head. Some lacing. Aroma: intense sweet cherries, raisin bread. Taste: Cherries, raisin bread and tropical fruits. Really sweet (little lack of balance here), with slight acidity at the end. Syrupy texture. Slight carbonation. Full bodied. Refreshing, but too much sweetness gives it a low drinkability. Good beer overall tough.

Bottle 750 ml. Hazy brown with a small persistent beige head and superb lacing. Theres a ton of sweet cherries in the aroma and slight sourness. Taste if full of sweet cherries. Mouthfeel is sparkling and slight acidic. This one is a true fruit beer and a super example of the style. Maybe a tad too sugary and it affect drinkability. Candy in a bottle!

Pours a dark ruby red. At first aroma is a bit of a couch syrup, but the big whiffs of fresh cherry really come through big and strong. Taste is super, natural tart cherry flavor balanced perfectly with the typical sweetness of a belgian ale.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2012 A - pours nice tan red with high head. Some lacing. S - nice strong cherry aromas. Lozenges up front, nice fresh and canned cherry smells. Hints of yeast in there. M - medium bodied. Nice rounded sweetness. Drinks like a nice cherry cider. Nice almost fizzy carb. Lingering sweet sour cherries. T - nice full bodied sour cherries, fresh cherries, and cherry cider all in one. O - amazing fruit beer. 8

Pours a vivid ruby red with a two-finger head. Amazing lacing. Excellent hoppy nose, punctuated with papaya and caramel. Intense herbal taste, laced with a touch of strawberry and grapefruit. Silky smooth mouthfeel and dry finish.

cloudy dark red, smooth light brownish head. Strong aroma of cherries, sweet marcipan, flavor is cherries, sour citrussy  tinge that works extremely well, like an ice cider, quite sweet in general but the citric touch makes it very good.
Perhaps my expectations were off for this one, but it just didnt do it for me. Too little fruityness, which made it almost feel bland.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2012 Has some powerful scents of cherries. Taste is intense of cherries and has a rather pleasant sour kick with it as well. Amazing for a fruit beer, but one for me is good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 750ml bottle to tulip glass:

Pours a bright pinkish red with a soft pink, sticky head that fades to a thin cap. Nice lacing and hazy beading.

Very pungent on the nose. So much fruit its ridiculous. Rich cherry, floral bits, white sugar, some honey... massive aromas.

Sweet. Tart. Sour. All cherries. I could never finish a whole bottle. Way too much flavor. Definitely an experience. Like no other beer that I can think of.

Drinkability is relatively low but its part of the experience. Its a sweet, aggressive sipper.

I can see why people go nuts over this stuff but its a bit much for me.
I loved it. Beautiful red colour. Tempting sweet cherry aroma. Refreshing palate. Delicious cherry taste. This was exquisite!
Powerful cherry aroma. Pours dark red with a pink off white head, nice lacing. Taste is very pronounced sweet cherry with a tart/sour element. Excellent lively palate. A great fruit beer.

Pours a dark red color with a finger head that disapates quickly. Aroma is pungent cherries, slight medicinal notes, slight oak Taste follows the nose, lots of cherries a bit of a medicinal taste but not off putting. Crisp, tart and refreshing. Different in the best possible way, tasting back to back with the raspberry tart and I must say I prefer the tart.
Loads of cherries and is slightly tart.  This beer is totally classic and awesome. I remember it fondly.
On tap at Sour and Bitter: Brownish red with a small off-white head. Aroma of fresh cherries and crushed cherry nuts. Tart cherry flavor with an almond essence like finish.

Keg at Sour & Bitter 2012. It pours hazy deep red, with a thin off-white head. The nose is sweet cherry, artificial notes, cherry tunes (the sweet), marzipan and almond. The taste is sweet cherry, residual syrupy sweetness, hint of tangy lime, cherry tunes and gummy bears, with a dry finish. Medium body, average carbonation and slightly sticky mouth-feel. I was hoping for a bit more tartness. Far too sweet. Tastes a lot like a commercial Belgian kriek.

On tap! Pours mahogany ruby red with no head. Aroma is candy like cherry, wild honey, gummi bears, vanilla, a weak tartness and some wilder notes way behind. A bit one sided, but pretty good. Taste is candy sweetness, red gummi bears, woody dryness, vanilla, concentrated cherry juice, light tartness and some spice.
Utterly delicious and perfect example of its style. Perfect blending of the cherry with the beer, far superior than the cherry stout by new glarus. Lighter red orange coloring with short head.
Sour & Bitter 2012, Copenhagen. REdbrownish beer with a offwhite head. Aroma and flavour i raspberry, raspberry, raspberry....Feels more like a swedisch cider than a beer.

Sample @ the Sour & Bitter event in Copenhagen. Pours hazy dark reddish brown with a small white head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace. Smell is sweet with burnt sugar, cherries, dandelions, brown sugar, lemon zest, orange zest and grass. Taste is sweet and sour with dark grapes, cherries, raspberries, burnt sugar, hay, dandelion and hints of brett. Mouthfeel is sticky sweet, tiny tart and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and sour with cherries, dark grapes, bread and burnt sugar. Smells and tastes like Dr Pepper. Luckily Im rather fond of that drink...

Fad: Rødlig uklar øl med et fint skumhoved. Tyggegummi duft slår dig imøde, masser af kirsebær. I en anden sammenhæng ville dette være en fantastisk sommerøl. Let syre giver en god smage, men bestemt ikke hvad jeg havde regnet med. Ved nærmere eftertanke får den lige et nøk op.

Tap @ sour bitter, pours ruby red, pretty! Aroma: candy store, heavy cherry, cherry cola, cherry pits, vanilla,  heavy sweetness, gummy bears, caramel, slight funk, Taste:  taste follows through, nice acidity, dry, but quite sweet, very refreshing, some metallic notes, minerals,

Tap & S&B courtesy of Rasmus. Pours reddish brown with a quickly dissipating head. Aroma has a lotnof cherries, just like Haribo cherry candies, some funky feet, just like when you've been touring London City for a whole day, sweet sweet cherry, a bit of pie crust maltiness. Taste is also all about the cherries, although more in the sour end of the spectrum. Some nice malt sweetness and very balanced. Lightly tart in the finish. A bit spicy in the throat as it goes down. Good, but I would prefer the apple ale thus far.

75cl Bottle at AHBS. Reddish amber colour, off white head. Aroma of sweet cherries, soda pop, marzipan. Flavour is rather sweet, almonds, marzipan, loads of cherry flavour, light tart finish. Light bodied. Nice, but why is this rated so much higher than e.g. Belle-Vue Kriek?

Poured a murky ruby red, with some orange and brown in there, as well. Appearance is very reminiscent of a Flemish red. Aroma is like melted cherry popsicle, jolly ranchers, cough syrup, flowers, and raspberries. Just a crazy sweet aroma and unlike any other beer I have smelled to date. Taste is sweet cherry candy, raspberries, and a light tart finish. Very creamy mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. A simply amazing fruit beer and right on point.
Nearly perfect fruit beer.  To put this one over the top, it need a bit more ABV.  This is a rare treat in CO and thanks to Hopscotch.  I held this one a long time and now must seek more.

Seems to be cherry candy. Carbonated cherry candy that sticks to the back of your throat. I know it's raved about, but it's a pass for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Originally reviewed: 2/15/10. Poured into a flute glass. Pours a very cloudy blood red. A thin tan head with light pinkish tones rests on top. Retains very well. Left little lace. My first though when I smelled this beer was Jolly Ranchers. This smells like any and every cherry candy out there. Very nice. 

Nice effervescent body. Carbonation level is spot on. Smooth finish. Wow. Flavors of cherries abound! Finishes tart and slightly drying. Mild bread flavors. Bitterness is low. This is all about the fruit. I could drink bottle after bottle of this stuff. The low ABV makes this extremely accessible. Splendid beer. I could have this and the Raspberry Tart for any celebration. Great job, NG!

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2012 A soon as you pour this brew you are hit with tart cherry notes. It pours a deep red brown color and pinkish head that pours very thick. Tastes like a fantastic cherry lambic (just brewed over the border in Wisconsin) the first taste tickles your tongue with tart notes then it finishes sweet. Almost no alcohol present (could use a higher abv). lovely beer. The 2012 version dropped this 4 ticks in overall....

Smells like cherry pie filling. Deep red color with a pinkish head. Tastes very sweet, cherry, tart, Its what Id imagine you would get if you mixed half & half Belgian blonde ale plus a berry wine cooler with a large glob of pie filling. Not really my thing.

Bottle thanks to either portableparty or mikem409.  Pours a murky deep red, with a medium-thick light beige head.  Aroma is sweet, of cherries, marzipan, some brown sugar.  Taste is obviously of cherries, very sweet with a little tartness.  Medium body, light carbonation, oily texture.  Refreshing.  I would have liked maybe a little bit more tartness, but thats my only complaint about this outstanding beer.
Pours a ruby red color with a pink colored small head.  Aroma is of cherries, and dark fruits. Taste is of tart cherries and very tasty. Medium bodied and easy to drink.

Pours a dark mahogany with a small head.  Immediate aroma reminded me of Cherry cough syrup. After a bit the tanginess disappeared and it smells more like grandmas cherry pie. Tastes very much like sour cherry pie flavor with a sweet finish.

Incredible aroma of cherry, gorgeous red-amber color, unbelievable taste of fresh cherries - quite sweet, didnt linger as long as expected on the palate. Overall an awesome fruit beer, highly recommend some chocolate while drinking it.

poured from 750 into tulip. Pours a nice medium red color with a small head

Very cherry dominated with some orchard fruits as well. Excellent depth and while a bit singular it brings a ton of various cherry aromas

medium bodied but on the lighter side with a real nice feel. All sorts of various cherry flavors with a nice tart finish

this is a real delicious beer. This brings a lot of great cherry flavors and does it great
Beer has dark red appearance with ivory head. Nice lacing down the glass. Initial taste is sharp however the cherry comes out almost immediately. Finishes mellow flavor lingers nicely.
Pours bright red and clear with low carb.  Nice aroma..full cherry tartness...some sweet finish.
Bottle as shown. Pours a clear red with a small off pink head. The aroma is cherry fruit. Thin mouthfeel with a syrupy cherry flavor and sweet finish. A very impressive fruit beer.

From bottle :  WOW.  I have been waiting forever to drink this and finally got around to it.  It was everything I had built it up in my mind to be.  Great pour with carbonation and a reddish fluffy head.  Aroma is fabulous and taste is a wonderful fruity blend of cherries and the like.  There is nothing I do not like about this and wish it was easier to get my hands on.

From notes.  First reviewed 6/12/2010.  Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a wine glass. 

Out of the bottle Belgian Red has a slightly opaque bright ruby red color with a 2 cm off-white head. It fades somewhat quickly but still leaves a bit of sticky lace on the glass. Very full color.

Tart cherries dominate the aroma. A little bit sweet as well.

There are strong tart cherry notes all the way through. Some sweetness sneaks in more and more as it warms, but cherry is in control the entire time. Nothing about this is incredibly complex, but it represents cherries very well without anything synthetic tasting or out of place.

Smooth and light on the tongue. Bubbly carbonation. Sweetness leaves the lips a bit sticky.

This is not the kind of beer I would normally think about sessioning, but it has such a great balance of sweet and (mostly) tart cherry flavor that this could be a surprise addition to my regular stash.

Split a 750ml bottle. Poured a bright, vibrant red color, medium pink head. Aroma was that fake candy/medicine cherry one, the one that people seem to either love or hate. Well, I love it, so I was hooked, even before taking a single sip. Its sweet - Ill give them that - I dont know how much of this I could really drink (as Id say about flavored sweet lambics as well). But yeah, this was an enjoyable brew for after-dinner.
this is a fruity beer. Great cherry taste with low alcohol. taste like a jolly rancher lol. definitely a chic beer.

Bottle purchased early Oct. 11 had on 2/19/12.  Probably should have had fresher, but this was still great.  Light, persistent head.  Good carbonation and heavy lacing.  Cloudy ruddy brown.  Nose has some sweaty funk, especially while head is present but mostly this is both huge ripe and rustic cherry.    Pleasingly both sweet and tart and just a huge treat-tastes like summer.  Just awesome.  Mixed about half of the bottle into cocktail with Lefthand Nitro Milk Stout in a 1:3 ratio and had it with smoked ribs and a Texas-style BBQ sauce...decent pairing.

It doesnt taste much like beer in the traditional sense.  Its more like the best strongly cherry flavored soda water.  Its a very tasty brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at the SuperBowl 46.  Smells fake cherry, tastes real cherry.  Flavor is just about the best fruit red cherry pie Ive ever tasted.  LOVE the flavor. But the aroma doesnt do it for me all that much. GOOD SHIT!
A very nice cherry sparkling ale.  Sweet and tart.  Great natural cherry flavor.

750 mL bottle.  Pours a ruby red with a slightly orange head.  Juicy cherry aroma, lightly tart.  Flavor again has the juicy, almost medicinal cherry, combined against undertones of toasty malt.  Dry, very slightly tart finish.  Definitely a really nice fruit beer.
Wonderful fruit beer with every swallow filled with cherry taste; however, the fruit is not too sweet or overpowering. A must try for any beer enthusiast or cherry lover.
One of the best beers ever created.  Solid bright red color,  pinkish head,  great retention rate.  Wonderful tart cherry flavor, not sweet , perfect. Best in style by far.

Possibly my favorite beer of all times, or at least in the category of "my favorite style."

Great cherry smell, whopping with gobs of fruitiness.  

Taste  follows right behind, amazingly sweet and full of great cherry goodness.

Body is sweet and so amazingly easy to drink youll wish you never ran out of the stuff.  

Hands down the best fruit beer Ive ever had.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2012 Strong sweet cherry aroma.  Pours a dark cherry red.  Taste is very sweet and a bitter tart after taste. A small hint of malt.  For its kind it is a fantastic beer but the sweet strength is a little overpowering for me.  Still worth a taste especially if you favor fruity beers.

750ml bottle, a gift from a friend, split with the family. Pours a deep ruby red color with a light pink head and some lacing. Aroma is fruity, cherry. Medium on the palate with soft, lively carbonation. Taste is sweet, almost too sweet, but not quite, with a strong cherry flavor. Amazing that this is beer, but it is absolutely delicious, in small quantities.

Split bottle with Sherm1016 and others...THANKS.  Pours a ruby red...initial nose screams "cough syrup" but only initial nose...milds out almost immediately to a richer cherry...always a cherry flavor but there are notes of hops and sweet notes....really unique...and tasty!
I had to break this out to show a friend what beer with fruit could be. Almost overwheleming, but so good!

i usualy dont like fruit/tart beer but giving them a try and with this i was glad i did!pours a reddish copper color with minimal head. very crisp and bubbly looking.aroma of funky cherries. the taste is like super sweet and tart dried cherries. leaves a crisp tingly sour felling on palate.

Pours red with small pink fizz. Smells strongly of cherries. Tastes like sweet and tart cherries. Medium-bodied with a sticky texture and lots of mouth-carbonation, New Glarus Wisconsin Belgian Red finishes with a strong, natural cherry flavor.

750 mL bottle.  Pours a hazy ruby red with a medium, pinkish head.  Head disappears quickly, but has some slight lacing.  Aroma is of sour cherries.  The taste matches the aroma; slightly tart cherries at the beginning, but the finish becomes bready and spicy.  The beer had a medium body with a lot of carbonation.  Outstanding beer overall.

Intense cherry
The best Ive had
I am humbled

750mL bottle, pours a beautiful ruby red with a small beige head. Aroma of rich sweet and sour cherries, quite sweet and real (nothing artificial here), and some tartness. Flavour of rich cherries, more tart than Raspberry Tart but still not much in the way of sourness / tartness, more intense carbonation as well but not detracting in the flavour. Not complex, but the intense cherry flavours are wonderful. I prefer Raspberry Tart but this is excellent as well.

Red amber beer, small beige head. Aroma of sweet, sweet cherries. And lots of them. Tones of cherry pips, almonds, more cherry. Flavour really sweet. How can it be so sweet with so little alcohol, I would expect it to yeast out further. Cherry, marzipan, cherry pips, light sour tone which surfaces a bit later when the initial sweetness has cleared a little. Finish somewhat tart with lots of cherry.
To my flavour it is way too sweet, but otherwise all the right flavours are there.
(From 75cL bottle shared with friends. With thanks to atxdelivery)

750 ml bottle
This thing is loaded with cherries. Notes of vanilla, cherry, wood, and spice. A great fruit beer.
Hazy deep red with a very minimal head, light lacing, nice retention... loads of cherry tartness aroma not in a sour or puckering way... big flavor, really cherry, lots of flavor, not very lively...
Wonderful. Pungent, sweet, sour.  A fruit beer that doesnt succumb to a candy-like cherriness.  The hallertau and "native" cherries seem to be made for one another.
Pours a clear and reddish/brown beer with a weak offwhite head. The aroma is fruit, cherries and marzipan. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is sweetness. Overall a good beer.

750ml into a tulip glass. Thanks to bobbypaulson for this want of mine!

A - Clear red/dark pink body with an off white head. Nice lacing and retention.

S - Amazing cherry aroma. It smells like a cherry chap stick...in a good way. Fresh and spicy with a bit of vanilla in the background.

T - Extremely strong cherries. Slightly tart and acidic with a smooth spicy backbone. Mouth feel is crisp and incredibly smooth and velvety.

O - Hands down the best cherry beer Ive ever tried. The aroma and mouth feel are excellent, but the taste is a bit too tart for me. Amazing stuff here!

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2014 3 Nov 2014, bottle. dark pink/light ruby. nose is sweet, slightly tart cherries and some yeastiness. thin/med body and moderately fizzy. tastes like cherry lifesavers, very faint tart notes, an odd yeast flavor that makes this more than just a tart cherry beer. rather nice but a little odd. 

(original rating - 7 3 7 3 15 = 3.5) 10 nov 2011, bottle. Pinkish amber faintly cloudy. Smells like cherry life savers. Really sweet. Thin body and almost flat. Almost sets your teeth on edge. Earthy, leafy cherry lifesavers. Really nice bit probably only in small batches.

This beer completely blows me away every time I try it.  It doesnt score near perfect in my books based on depth of complexity necessarily, but more so for the sheer pleasure I get from every sip.  I actually cant get enough of this beer.  When poured out, it possesses a deep, vibrant ruby color that makes you smell cherries before you even put your nose to the glass.  A rocky, billowing head sits atop this beer like a crown and follows it fully the whole way to the bottom.  On the nose, the beer gushes forth with wave after wave of deep, juicy cherry.  The fruit and the malts together give the cherries a sort of warm, bready character in the nose and remind me of someone leaving a freshly baked cherry pie out to cool on the windowsill.  On the palate, the beer is fresh and creamy, with a winelike finesse to it thats almost like a vinaigrette.  The cherries come in again in a gooey, warm, malty way thats not too rich or too cloying.  The winelike, slightly sour quality really makes itself known and works perfectly with the dark cherry character.  A perfect, lively carbonation just makes this ultimate beer harmony.  Overall, this is one of the classiest beers I have ever had.  I always wish it were easier to find so I could drink it all the time.

Superb seasonal from New Glarus.  Pours a cloudy ruby, with a fizzy white head.  Fruity aroma.  Taste is sweet berries, and a tartness on the back of the throat.  Has a bit of spice as well.  Light on the palate, very fizzy with a dry finish.   Overall, a very enjoyable and drinkable brew from perhaps the most consistent brewer in the midwest.  Excellent

I wish New Glarus was around me.  This stuff is delicious.  Just like the raspberry tart it is hard to classify as beer but you wont be dissapointed by the taste.  Medium sweetness and an amazing tart cherry flavor that is crisp and delightful.  Exceptional "beer"

Hazy ruby pour with a thick creamy khaki head with a hint of pink.  Strong sweet cherry aroma.  Difficult to detect anything else.  Very strong flavor of sweet cherry juice with a tart mouth puckering finish.  Creamy small bubble high carbonation level.  Very intense ... definitely something you need to be ready for.  Im not a huge fan of fruit beer but I can certainly appreciate this one and see why it a consistent winner.

At long last! Tried right after Rasp. Tart. Aroma of cherry cough drops, black cherry, menthol, cinnamon. This is also too sweet, but nicely tart as well in a more beery fashion. Slightly reminiscent of a Kriek. Huge cherry flavor with spice. Delicious fruit, nice tartness. A lovely beverage, but still too sweet for greatness as a beer.  Purely as a beer the rating would be lower, but frankly, it truly is delicious. Cant drink much, though.

Thanks to dedollewaitor. Blind tasted. Pours reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is cherries, marcipan and almond. Flavour is sweet cherries, marcipan and almond. Cloying, too sweet, light acidic aftertaste.

750, no head, sweet cherry sting smell. Flavors is medium tart with a vanilla finish. This finish lasts forever, sweet cherry tart gives way to vanilla 
sweetness. This is amazing, cannot believe this was cherries. Wow!

(bottle 8/22/11). Cloudy red color. Medium off white head. Moderate sweet cherry aroma. Flavor of the same, with light bready malt and light tartness. Avg duration. Light dry finish. Slick texture. Moderate carbonation. Fair lacing.

3 ounce taster glass at New Glarus Brewery.  Ill admit it: my tastebuds are untrained in the art of fruit beer.  This stuff tasted like cough syrup to me.  My message is, even if you enjoy extreme-flavored beer, cherry varieties may not be your thing.  Still, good luck to New Glarus on the frontier of brewing!

Pours a rich red-amber color with an only slightly tinted white foamy head. The aroma is that of freshly-pressed cherry juice just exploding from the beers surface.  The flavor is largely just more of the same, with a one-dimensional sweet cherry juice character. I dont get any interplay between the fruit and the grains, no balance from the hops, and no earthy/woodsy character that would be expected from the oak aging. The light, soft carbonation keeps the sweetness from overwhelming, and this beer can almost be considered refreshing. In the end, though, rather than a world class beer, this tastes like an all-natural version of Cherry 7-Up.

From bottle shared at Natifest 11 on August 6, 2011 and provided (I think) by Bigmmartin (thanks!).  Medium to dark red/amber color, firm cherry aroma, STRONG cherry flavor but you can still tell its beer.  A good change of pace brew.  Kool Aid grows up!

Pours a nice blush/rose color with a thick pink head...good retention and lacing.  Flavor has sweet cherry...like a cherry lollipop...but soft and not overly sweet.  Flavor is huge!  Loaded with sweet and tart cherry notes...a bit vinous with subtle oak notes and a hint of spicy hops.  Mouthfeel is lively and the finish is dry and leaves a great cherry flavor that puckers just a bit.  Wow!

Appearance is red with 1 finger pink head, visible effervescence, and good retention.  Aroma is sour cherries, almost too perfect to be true.  Taste is puckeringly sour with a very strong cherry aftertaste.  Not much wild yeast or barnyard notes going on.  Body is medium, frothy, average carb, dry finish.  Overall, very unique and crazy.  Grabbed a bottle for the cellar to savor the flavor of Wisconsin at a later date!

Shared a bottle with a friend in MN.  The beer is very much as advertised: a celebration of cherries.  It pours a golden-pink with fizzy head.  Aroma is cherry pie filling.  Many fruit beers end up tasting medicinal if not balanced correctly.  This one stayed very true to the cherry flavor, with a nice tart finish.  Its a fun departure from more standard beer.  Well done!

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2011 Cherry bomb of a fruit beer, taste and smell- cherries. Sweet front, tart finish. Good dessert beer and a good candidate to be served to wine fans. WARNING: this beer could be a gateway beer to sours!
This is a nearly perfect beer. Strongly cherry flavored without being overwhelming or off-balanced. Wonderful mouth feel.
Pours a bright red colour with a light head. aroma is excellent sour cherry. The flavor is a nice blend with of sweetie and sour super easy to drink.
Vivid red, cherry drops, tunes, too artificially fruity and sweet for my palate

[750ml bottle, courtesy of cgarvieuk] Blood red, thin lacing. Cherry aroma is so huge and prevalent; its almost artificial - similar to a Halls Soother dunked in cherry juice. Or like the lumpy fruit/jam you get in a Muller fruit corner. Very sweet, fruity intense cherry taste, as youd expect after the aroma. Good though. Really tastes of cherries. Like it [19082011]

Bottle at Craigs. Pours a nice red colour with a lacy beige head.  Aroma reminds me of cherry cough syrup. Really sweet cherry flavour. No almond. Lemon tartness that develops slowly and a foamy mouth-feel. This one divided opinion. Not really my thing, bit too sweet.

Bottle, thanx to Nisse666. Pours hazy reddish with a small, off-white head. Sweet aroma with lots of cherry, bitter almond. Taste of cherry, sweet/sour, very fruity. Nice flavours, but a bit to sweet imo.

750 ml bottle that poured pink, aroma of cherries, almost a hint of a full blown cherry pie in a bottle.  Drinks like cherry juice, not too sweet, not too tart, tasted like fresh cherries, unbelievable brew.
Deliciousness. Plain and Simple.  One of the most drinkable beers ever brewed.

Poured from 750ML bottle into a tulip.  Pours a deep pink color with a bit of white head with pink edges.  Aroma is nothing but cherries.  This smells exactly like cherry compote that comes out of a can to make cherry pie.  The flavor is tart cherries.  The finish is slightly dry like a nice lambic.  I really enjoyed this one.  We pondered pouring it 50/50 with a bottle of Choklat by Southern Tier to make the mother of all Black Forest Cake beers.  Maybe next time.

Poured from a Bomber bottle into a tulip glass.   The body of this beer is red with light red or pink along the outside of the glass.  It leaves behind great lacing.  It smells of fresh tart cherris.  The taste of this beer is of tart cherries with a seetness through the whole taste.  Not overly sweet so you are easily able to finish off the bottle.  Overall this beer is delicious.  If you are a fan of cherries you cant deny that this beer is king.

Pour from a bottle and shared with some appreciative friends at the Bruery in OC. Deep red in color with out much of a head. Aroma is voluminous with rich ripe fruit. Medium body and smooth in your mouth. Sweet raspberry with just a slight hint of tartness but not much. The fruit gives it a bit of sugary quality but not artificial or over the top. Finish is extended. Really liked this beer along with all else who sampled it.
bomber. Pours an amber with red tint highlights. Aroma is a fantasticly tart cherry. Excellent cherry taste with a nice balance of light malt, good carbonation, an excellent fruit beer.

Pours a translucent but vibrant (get this) cherry red.  The nose on this beer is otherworldly.  It reminds me of the sour cherries my grandparents grew on the farm I grew up on in rural Ohio, but the scent also has a Christmas-spice element to it (definitely cinnamon) that reminds me of potpourri.  The flavor is also spectacular.  Of course, the cherries this is brewed with dominate the flavor, with only a slight but refreshing sourness.  The freshness of this beer is remarkable.  It tastes like it was made of fresh, muddled cherries.  The beer also has a great mouthfeel, which you dont get from some fruit beers.  On the whole, this is without a doubt the best fruit beer Ive ever had and one of the best beers Ive ever had period.  I always thought the Founders Cerise was a solid offering (and it is), but this is in another ballpark.

Lived up to the hype and then some.  Really impressive.  Nose is the boldest Ive ever smelled.  Huge cherry aroma the flies in to your nose, you dont even have to hold the glass up.  Its cherry, not tart, light and refreshing throughout.  Imagine perfect cherry champagne thats not over-carbonated.  Really a delicious flavor.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Dave on July 29th.
Appearance: Pours a dark red opaque. 
Aroma: Aroma is of cherry and slight oak.
Taste: Sweet from cherry, some wheat.
Palate:Medium body, some carbonation.
Summary: Just like other New Glarus fruit beer I had, this barely tastes like beer to me. Its really good, and even people who refuse beer would like it.

1 Pint, 9 floz bottle. Red, a bit pink hazy liquid with small pink/white head. Aroma of cherries, cocktail cherries, a bit vinegar, cherry bubblegum, dr pepper, almond paste and quite sweet. Taste is sweet with lots of cherry notes and no bitterness and very light sourness. Quite dry. Light to medium bodied with high carbonation. Extremely nice taste... So good and very well balanced. Incredible taste for this ABV.

Bottle @ Blindtasting, Odense, July 2011. Pours unclear red with a small creamy head. Sweet nose of fresh cherries and a bit of almond , vanilla and marzipan. Sweet - not sickening but still a bit too much and one-sided.

Deep amber with a small off-white head. Strong sweet cherry aroma with marzipan, malt, caramel, and a hint of sugar. Very sweet cherry flavour with a faint tart note. Perfumed marzipan/cherry a bit cloying.

Date: July 22, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Discount Liquor, Waukesha, WI Appearance: Semi-Opaque dark red and thick head with some pinkish hue and decent lacing. Aroma: Huge cherry. Flavor: Cherry again, sweet start, tart in the middle with a dry finish, slight carbonation. Other: A very unique beer and pretty good, but a little too much cherry.

Pours a clearish brown with a hint of red.  They dont lie with the cherry aroma.  The foam is an off brown.  The taste is cherry. Cherry cherry. Ooo cherry cherry. My cherrys so fine shes cherry baby.  Did I mention cherries? Its all Im thinking about now.

Pour: Small head that dissipates quickly and leaves no lacing but does have the added sound of bubbles popping vigorously in the evening. 


Smell: Like cherries almost like a halls but alluring, not so much like medicine, but like a cherry soda. 


Tastes: Very tart, lots of cherry, and sweet. Tart sticks to your lips and gentle bitterness left on the back of tongue.


Body: Little carbonation but balances well with the tart. The sweetness is a little more then I care for but is refreshingly different then most that try to capture the sweet side.


Fruit is not my favorite style but NG does this nicely in an unthreatening way. I wouldnt have another by myself but would share one with some wine loving friends.
Poured from bomber. wonderful red color, small beige head. cherry aroma. great refreshing taste. awesome for a warm day. highly carbonated. overall, a very good cherry beer.

Bottle thanks the Santa. Brilliant dark red pour, light haze but quite clear. The aroma on this one was a burst of fresh sweet cherries. Quite incredible. It was hard to get past the hugeness of the cherry but some light bready malt crept in there somewhere. Flavors followed suit. Each sip exploded with sweet cherries, a decent tartness puckered the mouth a bit. Finished somewhat dry with a lingering tartness and fresh cherry goodness. Mouthfeel was full and a bit syrupy, lively carbonation without being fizzy. A+.

Tasted on 7/12/11 from a 750mL capped and waxed bottle purchased at Discount Liquor.  Pours a cloudy ruby color with a thin pink head that slowly recedes to a collar of lace, leaving a bit of lacing along the inside of the glass.  The nose is unadulterated sweet cherries with just hints of some light cereal malt and earthy yeast.  The flavor is much the same, dominated by sweet honeyed cherries, a hint of tartness, full cereal malt, and a very light earthy flavor as well.  The body is full, and almost syrupy with fairly light carbonation and a long sweet honeyed cherry finish.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2015 Bomber, courtesy of Nisse666. Pours cherry amber small with a pinkish tanned head leaving some lace. Aroma is sweet, cherry, malty, very pleasant. Flavor is sweet, very fresh cherry, pungeant, sour and bitter almond. Finishes sweet cherry and sour.

Bomber from cracked kettle cons 2011-07-09 Sätila
AR: lovely cherries, tart, flat
AP: amber/cherry thick juice, wee beige head
F: cherries, tart, loaded with wee soft bubbles, white peppery, angostura, bitter almonds. 4,3 Yolk is even more bitter 4,1 
Great to be able to share this one with this great crew of people

Bottle, thanks to Nisse666. Deep red beer with a small head. Sweet cherry aroma, a bit sourish fruity. Great cherry flavor, fresh sourish, sweetish, fruity, peppery, maybe some other spices, almond and rubber notes.

The beer have an intense red color with a hint of brown in it. Wow, the aroma is almost overwhelming. Its dominated by a big cherry aroma with bitter almond and caramel,  red apples, cinnamon and oak lingering in the background. The taste is also dominated by cherries, cinnamon and oak. It has a nutty bitterness to it that that i find most interesting. Finally the beer has a fizzy minerality that i find a bit disturbing. Overall a great fruit beer!

Bottle from a trip through wisconsin in the winter. Pours a clean ruby with a thin soapy white head. Smell is sweet and tart cherries with little else. Taste is SA-WEET with a great tart cherry backing to balance. This is one of those beers that I LOVE the taster of, but a pint would be a bit much- this rating number is an attempt to average out the two ...

750ml bottle thanks to thirdeye11.
Shared at my 3rd of July Throwdown Bash.  Wonderful dark red color with a decent amount of head.  Lots of fresh cherry aroma and flavor - probably one of the best cherry beers Ive ever had.  Nothing medicinal or astringent about this at all, just deliciously tart cherry with a hint of oak.  Not usually a fan of fruit beers but this is amazing!

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2011 Thanks to bobbypaulson. Pours and casades to a light red color with tons of white pink tinged head. Smells of a boat load cherries, some funk, oak and fresh baked cherry pie. Cherry pie, some tartness and an underlying sugar note. Very good as dessert beer and light on the palate.

Pours a bright ruby red with a rather pink head that forms nicely n the glass.  Loads of cherries initially in the nose with a touch of earth.  As it warms a touch, a strong doughy aroma develops giving this more of a cherry pie presence.  Its almost ridiculous how much this tastes like cherry pie.  Amazingly sticky dough, sweet and ripe cherries, almonds, and a refreshing wheat flavor.  Sweet and tart finish.

Just an amazing beer if you like cherry.  You can smell the cherries long before you take your first drink.  It does have a cough syrup smell but the texture is smooth and the lambic base taste does present itself after you take a drink.  Pours red with very small head.

Smells like cherry Dimetapp...maybe Ludens cough drops? Wow. Sweet and syrupy. Medicine-like cherry flavors. Good for what it is. Nice carbonation. Some chocolate malt base. Not really my kind of beer, but perfectly executed for what its supposed to be.

750ml bottle. Clear red with reddish white head that fades quickly. Cherry, somewhat tart but also sweet. nice carbonation, full bodied, great balance of cherry flavour, tartness and some sweet. Long-lasting finish, aftertaste is a bit of cough syrup but more cherry and some wood. One of the best cherry beers that I have had - worth seeking out.

750 bottle.  Ruby red pour with an average headbthst quickly disipates.  Nose is lots of cherries and some yeast and grain.  Taste is one of the best of any style.  A cherry malt bomb that is sweet but with a nice tartness on the back end.  Better than sparkling wine (which many compare it to) as the malt cuts into the sweetness very nicely.  Absolutely need to get a bunch of these.
Pours deep dark red with no head. Aroma is cherries. Not much else in the aroma but cherries. Taste is cherries with both sweet and sour notes. Medium bodied and medium carbonation. Very good beer.

On tap at New Glarus brewery. Deep red color, light white head that leaves a modest amount of lacing on the glass. Strong cherry nose, mild nutty malt note with a slight tartness late in the nose. Flavor follows the nose with a concentrated cherry fruit presence, mild maltiness in the middle of the tasting really helps to even out the fruit presence. Modest body, low but fine carbonation with a great tartness at the end and the sweetness is nice as it isnt sugary or syrupy. Overall a fantastic beer! I love the way this is perfectly balanced and makes it easy to drink such a sweet brew with the nice tartness to finish it. Flavor lasts quite a bit in your mouth afterword making it a great enjoyable brew.  Definitely a must have again!

A delicious and tasty fruit beer. Aroma was big and full of bright cherries. Nothing else. Pour was beautiful. Deep dark red with plenty of rising bubbles and no head. Taste was very thick, sweet and cherry. Nothing else there but cherries. Do you remember the cherry pop called Cherokee Red? Tasted like that. Medium carbonation. A little too sweet for my taste, but thats what they were going for. The aftertaste turned a little tart after the swallow. Delicious beer.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: fruity cherry and oak aroma, red, minimal head, white foam, clear, sparkling, light sweetness, medium dryness, tastes of dry cherry with underlying smoky oak and aged hops flavors.  Hard to conceive of a better fruit based beer.

garnet pour with a quick pinkish tinged head.
aroma is very tart, black cherry.
flavour is cherry again, woody bitterness. Very tasty.

Bottle, poured into a champagne flute. Dark purplish-red with slightly pink-tinted white head. Champagne-like bubbles floating constantly to the top. Nose is, you guessed it, cherries and more cherries. The taste is surprisingly mild (startlingly less tart than the NG raspberry beer), and goes down like a slightly thicker sparkling wine. Very clean finish. One-note, yes, but a very exceptional note it remains.

Courtesy of pfoxyjohn - the New Glarus man!  
Pours a deep reddish hazy color with a thin head but lots of lacing.  Some carbonation.  Aroma is of sweet, tart cherries and berries and some malts.  Taste is overwhelmingly cherries, but I love cherries, so this is fantastic.  Another winner from New Glarus.  Thoroughly enjoyable. My favorite beer - period.
Bottle shared with friends. Reddish color with a very thin head. Aroma and Flavor is just as I expected, fruity and delicious. Not surprises here, just a straight up cherry/fruit beer that kicks ass.

Bottle; thanks to murphym45 for this much sought after bottle. Pours a dark cherry with white lacing. Aroma is massive black cherry. Some yeast and brown sugar notes too, but this is heavy on the black cherry. The flavor is similar. Boatloads of black cherry, slight touch of brett, caramel, and a hint of vinegar. Starts off sweet and ends mildly tart and acidic. Slightly syrupy and quite prickly; almost soda-like carbonation. Its really good although not in the class of Enigma and Raspberry Tart.

Pour ruby/copper white head awesome lace. Aroma baskets tart cherries, quite sweet, and hints of a spicy yeast. Taste wow like drinking liquid cherry pie filling man, touch spicy, sweet and tart. MF light easy to drink mild carb. Man by a long shot the best fruit beer soooo much cherry character this is a superb beer. A+

Süßer Antrunk nach Marmelade, sehr süß, sich sogar noch steigernd. Dadurch kommen die Krischen nicht gut zur Geltung, das Bier ist aber erfrischend und passend fruchtig. Leckeres Bier, das mit einer gewissen Säuerlichkeit besser wäre. Zum Ende dumpf, leicht holzig. 9/9/10/8/12/9

Thanks for the taste, it had the nice and good looking colour. The beer pours a light head, the beer smelt of cherrys a bit of strawberry in there too. The taste was strong of cherrys, a very light yeast in the back. Overall, Tasty Stuff.

A - Pours a deep ruby brown color with a finger of frothy white head. The head fades pretty slowly down to a thin right and laces nicely in the process.

S - Aroma is packed full of sweet cherry. Really rich and tart. There is also some Belgian yeast beneath the cherry.

T - Starts off with rich slightly tart cherry flavor. The is some background oak and earthy flavor. Through the middle, the tartness builds a bit but stays really fresh tasting (not sugary). The finish is full of light tart cherry flavor that lingers just right.

M - Medium bodied with moderate-low carbonation. Just a but syrupy without feeling thick. Finish is a bit more syrupy but surprisingly not overly sweet and tart.

D - Really drinkable. Super bold flavors that just feel well balanced and never feel out of control. The fruit flavor is excellent in this beer. Finish is really nice, and not as palate blasting as expected.

Bottle sampled at DLD 2011.  Best fruit beer I have ever had.  Aroma is candied cherries with notes of sweet wheat, caramalized malts, and a very small touch of hops.  Palate is very carbonated, similar to Sprite.  Flavor is sweet and tart, finishing dry.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2011 Bottle at Dark Lord Day. Whoever brought this I thank you. Poured light red with small pink head. Very cherry flavours with lots of sugary sweetness coming through, almost like a jolly rancher. Slightly tart and not overly complex.  This is by far one of the best beers I have ever had. I could drink so much of this. Easily my favourite of the day.

Pours cloudy red in my snifter with virtually no head. Aroma is huge tart cherries. Body is light & crisp. I expected flavor to be much more sour than it was, but I absolutely loved the sweet/tart cherry flavor. Ive never had a beer with this much fruit character. Fantastic!

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2011 Bottle at the Old Fashioned in Madison, WI. Very cherry.  Sweet, refreshing, extremely crisp.  Good beer to share on a warm spring night.  The aroma is so pure and amazing.  Dazzling if youre a fan of the style.  Every time I have this, I appreciate it even more.

Kind of a cute beer. I really enjoyed it, a lot. Beer poured from a bottle into a becher glass. Beer is red and clear. White head but really thin, carbonation moderate and of small bubbles. Lacing is really high. Looks good.

Aroma is sweet and tart, smells like cherries.

This is an easy drinking beer. Its sweet and has a good fruit flavor to it. Carbonation sours the beer a little but it just serves to bring out the fruit flavor more. Drinkability high mouthfeel good.

Resampled February 8, 2010:

Beer is poured into a snifter glass. Beer is dark red and hazy. Froms a thin white head that leaves lacing on the glass. Carbonation is moderate.

Aroma is much stronger than I remember, very cherry, almost like cherry candy jolly ranchers.

Lots of carbonation on the tongue, great sour / tartness. I seriously love this beer.

Its less like beer and more like cherry soda.

Serving type: bottle

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2011 (750ml bottle courtesy of Alpar!).  Pours hazy red juice color with minimal head.  Aroma of maraschino  cherries. Taste is sweet.  Medium bodied with a luscious, ripe fruit finish.  Man, this is a delicious beer. This is the holy grail of fruit beers.

This fruit beers pours a deep red, almost purple with a light pink head that has a dash of brown in it. The head rises about 2 inchecs and has decent retention, no significant lacing.

The aroma is big and bold with lots of sweetness. It smells totally of cherries, like a nice cherry slushy. There is a hint of cola and smidge of tartness. 

The taste is very sweet, once again almost all cherries is what you get. The sweet is very nice, but lightly let down and not rewarded with any sour or tart bite to it. The sweetness is great but makes it hard to drink a lot of it without it being balanced between sweet and tart.

The mouthfeel is light and its very drinkable despite how sweet it is.

bottle thanks to Bertram; had been saving this for my 200th rating!!!

Unique is an understatement for this beer; cherries/fruit and carbonation were in the aroma (if that is possible)  Ruby pour with slight pink white head.  

Did I mention unique??  Didnt see others mention it, but to me this was champagne (not wine as bottle states) mixed with beer - then there was a bunch of sweet sticky cloying cherry sweetness (sweet more than cherry).  As much as I wanted to like this (my 200th rating!) I didnt...

Not sure it is even a beer in the end; not sure I can finish the bottle;  kudos to the effort (I still want to try much more NEw Glarus) but the result doesnt work for me...

Amazingly unique beer. Small, reddish white head. Cherry and malt aroma. Appearance is cloudy, dark burgundy. Taste is predominantly cherry with hints of malt and hops. Slightly fizzy. A definite favorite.

Bottle courtesy of James during his move to NYC.   Pour is ruby, nose is rich cherry.. Some robituson.  Taste is minerally, rich, intense cherry flavor.   Very good but NOT better than phoenix kreik in any way.

From a 750ml bottle from kbutler1.  Pours a deep red with faint to no head into a 4oz tasting glass.  Very distinct cherry aroma that lasts through out the glass.  The taste is cherry through and through.  Not overly syrupy sweet like similar fruit beers Ive tried in the past.  This is a beer that you can tell has 1lb of cherries in it.  More distinct in its fruit makeup than Raspberry Tart in my opinion but both are fine beers.  This is one I want to get again to try with others who have little to no interest in beer and show them what the spectrum really is like.  A simply outstanding beer.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: really discernible cherry aroma, dark dark red appearance, drank from glass, syrupy feeling on the palette

Enjoyed from a 750ml bottle in a stemless wine glass.  The beer pours a nice ruby color, with a low head.  The nose shows notes of cherries, far fuller and with more depth than many other fruit beers.  The palate shows a level of sweetness similar to, if not quite as aggressive as, the Raspberry Tart, but stops short of cloying, and shows a level of fruit character unseen in any other example of the style Ive tried.  I was expecting some tart character, given the brewers prowess with lactobaccilus, however, none was found.  The finish is semi-sweet, and leaves a nice lingering note of the featured fruit; more refined and far less jammy than the aforesaid Raspberry Tart.  Overall, it is easy to see why there is so much hype for the beer, as it is the single best fruit beer available.

medium brown with large white head.  huge nose of cherries with touches of belgian esters, very aromatic brew.  some bitterness before a lot of cherries and some esters.  this brew is excellently fermented with very little residual sweetness and a nice lingering cherry flavor on the palate.  a well crafted and unique fruit beer.  very good

Aroma: a flood of sweet and sour cherry dominates the nose, with hints of toasty malt barely peeking through.  Appearance: pours brilliant red, mostly clear, unstable head dissipates quickly to a thin layer, some lacing.  Flavor: again very much dominated by cherries.  While the beer is cold, both sweet and sour cherry notes are present, and the sweetness is somewhat under control.  Some malt character and faint oak.  As it warms up, it really becomes quite sweet and the finish goes towards syrupy.  Palate:  medium-full body with high carbonation, becomes rather thick as the beer warms.  Very enjoyable brew if youre ready to be attacked by cherries, maybe a bit too sweet in the finish, but overall well done.

Bottle thanks to Glouglouburp. Beautiful ruby pour with a bit of frothy pinkish foam. What can I say about this beer, lets see, at first the aroma was super intriguing, tons of real cherries. Very intense and inviting. Shortly after the initial whiff though, it starts to smell like cough medicine (still okay but not quite my favorite smell) and then it actually starts to literally smell sweet. Okay, taste now. The first few sips are like the first few whiffs of smell. Great real cherry taste, sweet and definitely not sour.
5 minutes in and Im sick and tired of the syrupy flavor. Palate is flat and super sticky. I wanted to like this beer so bad, but in the end three of us ended up drinking a quarter of the bottle. I do believe it will make great ice cream sauce.

Pours a slightly hazy reddish/tannish color into a goblet. Nice big light tan head that is slow to reside, and leaves a nice lacing on the sides of the glass.
Smells of fresh cherries, cherry juice, Sucrets.
Tastes of cherries are bountiful. Little bit on the sweet side, but not so much as it detracts from the overall flavor. Little sour on the back side. Great taste.
Sweetness coats the mouth and lips. The cherry sourness sticks to the sides of your tongue almost making you pucker. But not quite.
The cherry flavor would kind of get to me after a long bit, but I enjoyed drinking this one so much that I wish I had more. Maybe Ill retire near the brewery. Quite refreshing on a hot summer day. I would put this as a very drinkable beer.

750ml capped and waxed green bottle. A "World Champion" according to the label.

Pours into my oversized wineglass with a borwn/red hue. A small bubbly white head rises a centimeter high with a vigorous pour.

Smell is of cherries, nothing much more than that. It does smell delicious though.

Has a solid tart Wisconsin cherry flavor that mixes with a tad bit of malt giving a cherry pie feel. I really like the taste of the cherries, there not the crappy sweet variety but there is an ample amount of sugar backing. It seems like there might be a few spices thrown in as well. Nice mouthfeel with good carbonation that coats the tongue.

Drinkability is that of fruit juice.

Its a great fruit beer if a bit sweet.
Pours a hazy, red amber.  Instantly smells of cherries.  This lingers in your nose as you taste it some more with a sweet tart finish that is smooth and light.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 A little sweet for my tastes and not totally my thing but it is a very good example of what it is. Not too sweet in general and not too tart. Quite nice. Serving: Bottle Re-Rate Thanks to Mike and Sarah. Um, this batch had much more of a cough syrup thing going on does this differ greatly by batch?

UPDATED: APR 23, 2012 Bottle. 24.5 oz. Pours a nearly opaque, glowing deep ruby with a bubbly, fizzy pink head. Tremendous cloudlike, chunky lacing. Aroma of Ludens cough drops, pure dark cherries, pie crust, brown sugar, and notes of subtle, buttery yeasty dough. Medium to slightly robust bodied with a mellow, creamy, sweetly tart mouthfeel. Spacious, slow, and tangy finish. Straight Ludens. Cheers

750ml bottle courtesy of GatorBeerNerd. Pours a dark red with nice light lacing, great sweet cherry aroma, sweet with a nice tartness. Sweet, fruit but not overly so, this is delicious, wonderful, amazing.

Received this in trade from dirtylou and then a day later from initiative thanks guys.
Pours a ruby amber red color with a thin off white head that left quickly. Smell is overwhelmingly cherries yum! Dried fruit/prune in the background. Taste is tart cherries has almost a sticky syrupy feel to it. Leaves a tart cherry aftertaste. My mouth literally was watering with every sip. Not exactly a kriek as its not nearly that sour, but a damn fine brew nonetheless.

A wonderful fruit lambic. This beer has a very nice balance of tartness from the cherry to the sweetness. I do get a very slight bitterness, as if it came from that tart quality of the cherry, but still a very fine beer.

From notes:

Pours a very dark ruby red color with a thin fizzy pink head that quickly fades into a lasting ring. Minimal spots of lacing left.

Slightly tart and earthy aroma with a huge blast of cherry. It smells slghtly syrupy but the nose is dominated by the fresh cherries without much else to talk about.

Soft carbonation up rent with a huge sweet cherry flavor that dominates and lingers throughout into a slightly tart sweet finish. There is a subtle oak presence and some earthy wooden notes possibly from the cherry pits. This beer is very sweet but somehow manages not to be over the top with just a touch of balance that smooths things out. Very faint syrupy texture but not cloying.

Im usually not the biggest fan of dessert beers but this is delicious and extremely quaffable. Much better than he Raspberry Tart.

Poured into a tulip. Thanks to alcstradamus for this one.

4.0 A: Murky amber red color sort of how dried blood looks. Two fingers of frothy white head with average retention and some lacing.

5.0 S: Holy shit, the cherries. I just had the Raspberry Tart and this is pretty much the same aroma, but with cherries. Cherries, cherries, cherries! Nothing but cherries. The cherries block out everything else. I didnt give the Tart a 5 on the nose, because I appreciate complexity, but i cant not give this a 5 because its so damn enticing.

5.0 T: Again, the cherries dominate the hell out of this beer, but it doesnt matter. Its so damn tasty. Cherries are mainly sweet, like maraschino cherries, but not in a fake way. Theres a subtle tartness that balances the sweetness well. Like the Tart, there isnt any malt or hops to talk about, but Im sure they do their part in the background.

5.0 M: Medium body. Good moderate carbonation is spritzy and dances on the tongue. Super smooth.

5.0 D: I need more of these fruit twins. This is the PERFECT dessert beer for both beer aficianados and BMC guzzlers alike. Im both sad and disgusted that I only have one bottle left.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-02-2010 06:26:53

Really nice fruit beer.  Wonderful cherry aroma and flavor.  Pours deep red with fading head.  Attention to detail is apparent in this beer, very light hop character and great light drinking belgian wit undertones.

Hazy reddish pour light light lacing .... aroma of ludens cough drops. Taste is tart and sour cherries with dry cherry finish....  fresh cherry yum cant really taste much else. Just a cherry explosion

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 Bottled at Bull and Bush Xmas tasting in Denver, Colorado. Very red appearance with an unbelievably strong cherry aroma. Mildly sour cherry flavor thats quite but not overally sweet. Quite carbonated and very delicious.

Bottle into snifter.  Aroma is amazing; like a cherry tree punching you in the face.  Taste is similar with almost a strange ludens cough drops taste.  Overall a great beer and second best to only the raspberry tart.
Even non-beer drinkers LOVE this beer.  It is the best $8 Christmas or birthday present you can buy!

Oooh, Pannepot may have met its match!  750mL waxed bottle brought back from Fond du Lac by a co-worker (thanks a ton!) two weeks ago.

Pours a semi-hazy ruby with a tan tinge and a well-fed off-white foamy head that doesnt last at all, but sticks nicely to the glass.  Aroma is potent, with sour cherries on top of bing cherries on top of cherry liquer, with a touch of almond aroma mixed in for an attempt at depth. :)

Flavor isnt exactly complex, but its great nonetheless.  More of what youd expect - cherries.  Not cherry extract though, this is the good stuff!  Sweet and tart cherries are balanced (to whatever extent one can balance cherry flavor) with nice earthy hop/malt flavors.  The only thing on this brew that takes a hit is the palate score, as I just cant see a session with the overwhelming mix of cherry flavor and high carbonation!

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2015 Bottle, 2000 Vintage, at the 2010 Funky 6. Incredible. Pours cloudy red with a medium, off-white head. Big aroma of sweet cherries, with hints of sourness. Flavor is very sweet, lots of ripened cherries, juiciness, some acidity. Medium bodied with soft, massaging carbonation. Lightly tart on the finish with long, lingering cherry impressions and fruit sugars. Wonderful. (August 2010, score: 4.4)

Bottle thanks to polomagnifico. Pour nice reddish color with slight white head. Nose is sweet and full of cherry aromas. Flavor is same as the nose with nice cherry flavors showing up and a slight bit of tartness at the end. Nice long finish to it as well. Great beer that would go great with dessert.

750 ml. bottle. I had this on Thanksgiving. Thanks, bro, for hooking me up with this insane bottle. Ive had this a few times, but have failed to rate it. This beer has a nice diaphanous appearance with a dark ruby color. I didnt try to agitate the beer while pouring to produce a head because the head doesnt last long. Very fruity bouquet of cherries. Ive never smelled a cherry beer like this beer. Generally, cherry beers tend to be subtle, at least the ones that I have had, but this is completely different. Nothing in terms of oak or hops come through in the aroma, but thats fine with me. I wish the oak would stand out more, but trust me, the aroma is still wonderful without it. Lovely, soft texture that glides easily across the taste buds. Not very effervescent, but that is a good thing, trust me. The cherry flavor is simply divine. Im usually not a fan of the fruit beers, but New Glarus seems to have something unique in the way that they brew their fruit beers. This is truly a great beer.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 G: Half poured into a brandy snifter and half poured into a flute, per the bottles suggested glassware.

A: Beautifully bright dark cherry color with an off-white, red-tinted head that recedes rather quickly. Pretty decent lacing.

S: Sweet and tart cherries. Not that anyone outside of Chicago would recognize this reference, but it reminds me of the smell of a Jewel cherry lattice coffee cake, which in my book is a very good thing. Dont want to harp on this too much, but its unbelievable how much cherry smell there is without at all smelling like cherry cough drops or medicine.

T: Quite tart at the outset, fading into an incredible cherry sweetness. Cherry perfection. 

M: Light-bodied with moderate carbonation and a constant tartness. Beautiful.

D: Absolutely sublime. If I were able to get this at all times, I would never have a mimosa ever again. The perfect fruit-flavored concoction and a wonderful almost-summer treat. So long lawnmower ales, hello Wisconsin Belgian Red.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-12-2009

head: some bubbles
colour: hazy soft red 
smell: sweet, almunds, marsipan ,
taste: sweet, some vinegary, sour, raspberry, "poepegatjes" ( famous belgian sweet cherry candy ) not bad beer but if a bit more sour , would be allot better !!

Pours a dark ruby red with a pink foamy head. Sweet cherry flavor more like cherry soda then cherry beer. Its really incredible. I got it from a friend who went to Wisconsin and shipped me a case, delicious.

750 ml bottle from Skyview. A red beer almost brown that forms a nice head in the tulip. The aroma is obviously loaded with cherries. Very full carbonation. The taste is wow cherry pie with even pie crust in there. I like how the cherries are the pie filling and the malt tastes like pie crust. Mmm cherry pie in a glass. Brilliant.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 11/10/10.  Hazy, tea-red in the glass.  Aroma is pure, sugary cherry (i.e., pie filling) with a tight, dry finish.  Sweet cherry taste thinning to a tingly, stealth bitterness on the finish (perhaps the hops).  Some slight tart in the mid-taste.  Remarkably unique beer albeit a touch too sweet for my personal tastes.  7/3/7/3/17.  Rerate.  Deep cherry red pour with some haze from the 2nd half of the bottle.  Smells like cherry pie filling.  Taste is sweet cherry with a light, complimentary tart.  Precise mouthfeel.  Unlike my earlier rating this does not seem too sweet and its hugely drinkable.  Worthy of a higher rating.

YUM! It smells of sweet candy, Juicy Juice Cherry with floral undertones. Pours golden copper with a pink tinge and sticky lacing. Taste is tangy, tart, sweet, apples, cherries and spice. Its like drinking a jolly rancher! Minimal carbonation.  Could drink this for dessert!

Notes from Saturday, July 23, 2010
On tap at New Glarus Brewery

Ar: Huge sour cherry nose with a bit of wood and very light vanilla.
Ap: Light red/pink with an extremely light pink head.  The head dissipates rather quickly.
F: Lovely sour cherry with just enough tartness to balance the sweetness.
P: Lovely champagne-like bubbles.

O: I shouldnt love this beer as much as I do, but I do.  Its absolutely fabulous. Probably not as complex as Belgian krieks, but Im a bit crazy about sour cherries.

Bottle from stensler. Pours a beautiful pink/red color. Aroma is an explosion of cherry that practically knocks my socks off. High carbonation is accompanied by a rich and complex flavor and cherry, malt, acid from the fruit and a hint of sweetness. Fantastic.

750 acquired via trade. Pours a medium hued red with a bit of tannish foam and no lacing. Aroma is pungent, ripe cherries and a light bit of funk, maybe even some cinnamon? Easy on the nostrils. The flavor is like a cherry punch to the throat, but strangely I kind of enjoy it. (I usually only like cherries and cherry pie, not cherry flavored things). Very smooth and easy drinking, and while I dont feel the urge to ever drink it again, its still one of the best fruit beers Ive ever had.
pour from bomber-red pour -creamy white pink head-aroma and taste of sour fruit cherries ,cream- finihes really tart but cant wait for the next sip.

Bottled, at BBC Wort Hog Club October 2010 tasting. Finally got a chance to try some! Red pour, pinkish white head. Huge cherry cough drop nose. Flavor is tart cherry pie with a malty backbone and sour finish. Well-carbonated mouthfeel. Wonderful!

Poured into 2 large wine glasses to share with a friend. Fantastic aroma that overpowers the local vicinity. Ruby red coloring with some nice lacing and a strawberry-cream head. The best way to describe this "beer" is an alcoholic cherry cream soda with a slightly bitter aftertaste. This would be an excellent dessert beer and I thought it was balanced nicely. It was somewhat over-the-top, but it could have turned out terribly if attempted by other brewers. This beer redefines what "beer" can be.

If you love cherries and ciders, you will love this beer. I love the thought, and concept, but the cherry sweetness is a bit overwhelming for me. I think I would have appreciated it even more if I had a champagne flute and some warm, flaky-crusted fruit pie. 
Beer pours a dark red color with a powerful cherry aroma. Highly carbonated, similar to a champagne. Deep, rich, and sugary cherry flavor is apparent immediately.

This one gets a 100% All across the board.  On tap at the oktoberfest celebration at the brewery.  Tested a sampler and brought back 2 bottles.  The smell is of a fresh, cherry field farm.  Its hard to tell the grains that were used for this.  A pound of cherries are used in each bottle.  The appearance is a dark ruby color.  Very sweet and tastes like cherry juice.  Highly carbonated and heavy lace built up around the edges.  A great after dinner drink or to share with your girlfriend in celebration.  We bought the gift set and cant wait to try out our new champagne glasses from the brewery..
This wacky brew is awesome.  Its basically just as described by the brewer above.  Get a bottle, it deserves the top 50 rating..........

after having a couple pretty good cherry beers over the last couple days, i started to become a little worried that i was hitting the top of the shelf for fruity, and that this beer would fall somewhere just above a 4. That wouldnt have been a disappointment, but there are a lot of 4 beers out there. Well, no worries there. My nostrils were assualted with the aroma of a liquified and carbonated cherry pie, and a good one at that. Holy @#$%! The body was a touch more brick red and less purple, and like I said, the aroma was heavenly. Combine that with just right carbonation and a wonderful fresh cherry flavor with a perfect balance of sweet & tart that I am still having a hard time wrapping my head around, and this was one of the best beers, and easily the best fruit beer Ive ever had. Thanks to Beerhunter for the trade...while i owe you a debt of gratitude, I now have to think of a way to hit you up for another, and maybe a raspberry tart and/or coffee stout as well :) Still not sure 24 hours later how they made a fruit beer this good!"

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2011 Poured from bomber, purchased at the New Glarus Brewery.  I also had a taster of this stuff at the brewery, and man is it good.  Appearance is a rather dark ruby red with a thin white head.  Aroma is like Cherry 7-Up, cough drops, and sugar.  Taste is really not as sweet as I thought it would be but very heavy on the cherry taste.  Surprisingly a little bit of crispness and very smooth, not really as carbonated as I thought it would be as well.  Quintessential dessert / after dinner beer, great stuff.

Bottle obtained in trade from atxdelivery.  Cranberry red pour.  Funk, wood and office supply warehouse aroma.  Taste is lightly sour, with hints of cherries, earth and vinegar.  Tart finish.  Complex and excellent!

Thanks to savvy1982 for the share. Pours a muddy brown with a small off white head. The aroma is sweet, funky, oaky and jammed with cherry. The flavor has cherry skin, clove, nutmeg, oak, and a lingering sweetness. Lively carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2011 I kinda enjoyed this... uh... "beer," but I have no idea how to rate it or what the hell I would do with a bottle if I had one.  That said, I would enjoy another small taste to give it a fairer shake.  This beer was quite sweet and tasted like concentrated cherry pie filling.  Good cherry pie filling, though, and no artificial fruit flavor.  That said, theres a strong cough syrup flavor in there, too.  The feel is less sticky than the taste would suggest, but it was still a bit much, at least coming to the beer without any foreknowledge.  Little to no oak was evident.  This is a beer that I might enjoy a lot more in specific circumstances, like as a compliment to a fancy dessert, but I cant say that I loved it on its own.  It definitely gets an entry in my list of beers to revisit.

Bottle: Poured into a flute - Well, theres nothing I can say that we dont already know. However - I will say that everyone in my group actually gave the Nod to their rasberry over the cherry by the slightest of margins. The cherry, I feel, has that slight cough syrup sweetness that isnt present in the aforementioned, and because of that, I (we) declared it the winner. The smell on this one is incredible though - Just an amazing brew either way -

Bottle. 24.5 oz. Split with James and Vin. Pours a nearly opaque, glowing deep ruby with a bubbly, fizzy pink head. Tremendous cloudlike, chunky lacing. Aroma of Ludens cough drops, pure dark cherries, pie crust, brown sugar, and notes of subtle, buttery yeasty dough. Medium to slightly robust bodied with a mellow, creamy, sweetly tart mouthfeel. Spacious, slow, and tangy finish. This is the best fruit beer I have ever tasted. Hands down. Cheers.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2011 Bottle split with pat and vinny. Pours a dark, hazy red blood body. Aroma is absurdity - the greatest sour cherry pie Ive ever smelt. Mouthfeel is perfectly orchestrated - showcasing notes of sour ripening cherries, cherry pie, sweet sugar, slight bready crust.

Poured from a 750ml bottle, but unfortunately had to drink from a pint glass.  Bottle courtesy of RJ and Janet - shared with BF.  Pours dark red, with little carbonation.  Subdued notes of cinnamon and malt, but cherry obviously overpowers.  Tastes of real cherries, not the canned stuff.  This truly is a fantastic beer, but one glass is enough.  I could not drink one after another......... had to switch to dancing man and crackd wheat.  Again, New Glarus fails to disappoint.

Bottle thanks to daknole. Bottle pours deep red-brown with an off-white head.  Aroma is huge cherries and baking spice.  Flavor shows the same with sweet and tart cherries being supported by a brown sugar pie crust malt.  Overall the sweetness is moderate to heavy, but is cut nicely by the carbonation and acidity.  This stuff is delicious.

The ulltimate cherry pie beer. Poured with a huge, foamy, frothy, thick, light tan head and a little lace. Color is red amber. Aroma is malt, sour cherries, and spice. Flavors exactly like nose. Body is perfect and carbonation is the ultimate and cuts through the flavors exactly right. Finish is fairly long and exquisite. Not a session for me, but a great beer for desert or on a picnic.

Think I may have been in the Schravenacker at this point? It was all getting hazy from here on in. Loved it. Bottle thanks to Sim I think? Cherry red with a thin pale pink head. Cakey marzipan getting its head kicked in by an army of cherries type aroma. Definite play doh like sourness with the cherrys. Well balanced and a lovely smooth finish.

The beer pours a deep red, off-white head.  The aroma is TONS of cherry, very tart AND sweet.  The flavor is more cherries, but more tart than the aroma.  It leaves a slight sting on the lips, like ginger.  Slightly sour as well, probably from the wheat.  Tart fruit finish, light hop bittering, like noble hops.  Medium in body, high in carbonation.  Enjoyable beverage, not for everyday, but interesting.

A-pours a clear ruby red that is quite attractive, the head is a faint pink color, dense and creamy with a decent lace left behind.

S-wow, Ive never smelled cherries like this, the are absolutely beautiful, tons of ripe fresh wet cherries with just a hint of sourness to it, notes of sugar and a touch of bready malt.

T-the taste is much of the same, bready malts, sugar, and the tastiest, ripest, juiciest cherries Ive ever tasted.  There is a light sourness but definitely present and adds some champagne like qualities to this.

M-medium bodied, smooth, creamy and syrupy with a champagne like feel as there is a ton of carbonation to add balance to the full texture of this brew.  it is also somewhat dry in the finish.

D-this is just tasty, it isnt complex or adventurous, its just tons of delicious cherries with a light to even moderate amount of sourness with a great feel to it and enough malt body to give it some balance.

Bottle. Pour is dark red brown with a quick frothy head and solid lacing. Aroma is sweet tart cherries. Taste is sweet tart cherries again with a nice malty finish. Palate is sticky and chaulky which finishes dry. Very nice, I found it well balanced.
Pours with red color with white head, has aroma and taste full of cherries, this is a treat for sure!
Pours ruby red with no head or lacing.  big, cherry candy aroma.  Lovely, sweet taste with just a hint of bitterness to remind you that this is really a beer.  tart finish.

750 ml bottle poured into a tulip.  Pours a reddish-brown with thin off-white head.  Aroma of sweet cherries and slight sourness.  Taste is sweet and tart, but not balanced enough for me, its too sweet.  The more I drank it, the harder it was to drink because the sweetness became overwhelming.  Nice beer, but in small doses.
Bottle shared by Plovmand, thanks alot. Redish bodywith a medium pink head. Aroma is cherry winegums and caramel. Flavor is cherries and notes of almonds. Way overrated.

Bottle. Hazy reddish orange body with a creamy white head. The aroma is mainly sweet cherries and caramel. The flavour is light peppery, lots of cherries, light acidic with some almond notes. Full bodied. Its a good fruit beer but it did not live up to my expectations.

Pours murky red brown with a small white head.  Aroma of cherries, sweet candy, and some spice.  Flavor is sweet cherries and some subtle spice with a little bit of tartness in the finish.  This is well balanced with the malt characteristic, and is my favorite of the new glarus fruit beers.

Adrian910ss shared this bottle on a rainy night while camping. I was miserable and then I tasted this beer. It pours a cloudy, deep brown colou with a reddish tint and a frothy cream coloured head. It smelled like hawaiian punch and I was hoping it wouldnt taste like sugary juice. Boy, was I pleasantly surprised but I guess I shouldnt have been. After all...its New Glarus!!! The Red has an aroma of maraschino cherries, some malt, a bit of oak, and not much else. It tasted like sweet, tart and slightly sour cherries and a smooth boozy taste. New Glarus does it again, but then again, I am partial to fruit beers.

Bottle kindly shared by plovmand, thanks body its very appreciated even tough I dont like it! 
Pours redish with a off white head. 
Aroma is cherry winegums and children vitamins. 
Flavour is sweet cherry children vitamins like, not good.. Long unpleasant after taste.
A tasty treat.  My favorite Belgian style cherry beer.  If in Wisconsin you must try this beer!!

Bottle, thanks to Skyview. Pours hazy deep brown/red, medium off-white head, not terribly persistent, no lacing to speak of. Nose is maraschino cherries, as well as sweeter natural cherries, especially Bing cherries. Also some cinnamon/clove/citrus cherry note that reminds me of Cherries Jubilee. Similar aromas to cherry blossom ice cream. Flavors are cherry, sweet and spicy, soft mild booziness, very complete cherry flavor. Really nice, but Id rather have the Raspberry Tart.

pours deep brown and very cloudy with a thick foamy head that dissapates quickly. Strong cherry aroma. With a slight waxy smell. Flavour is very nice. Lots of cherry. Sweet in the start and very tart in the finish. Very thick mouth feel.  A very nice kreik.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2010 Bottle. Pours a clear reddish brown hued color with a slight red head that pillows to the top of the glass. Honestly, the aroma is strong smell of cherry fruit punch! When you drink this I think it would be totally possible to not really know it is beer. Ever so slight tart beginning that transitions to a full boddied cherry flavor. Very clean tasting.
